Job Application for Technician, Microbial Downstream, Manufacturing  at AGC Biologics 




















      Apply Now
    
Technician, Microbial Downstream, Manufacturing 

    at AGC Biologics 
  
(View all jobs)

      Copenhagen, Denmark
    


Do you want to be part of a company helping customers bring new advanced biological products to market? And do you thrive in a role where you learn and develop? Then these roles as a technician in our downstream team could be something for you. 
AGC Biologics is a Contract Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with facilities in Denmark, Germany, Japan and USA and with customers from all over the world. We have more than 35 nationalities employed and the daily language is English.
The position
You will become part of our manufacturing area consisting of five production lines, which produce pre-clinical, clinical and commercial products for a wide variety of different customers coming from around the world. You will be part of a group of highly dedicated technicians and scientists working with various stakeholders such as QA, QC and Development.
As a Microbial downstream technician, you will work in a GMP environment with batch execution, batch documentation and optimization of purification process flows. The Downstream unit operations runs on heavy machinery such as centrifuges and homogenizers, and you will be part of cleanings as well as filtration, TFF, chromatography and UNICORN bioprocesses. In this role, you will work on the floor during production and be engaged securing batch readiness and release and you will take part in the maintenance of equipment.
Qualifications and experienceOur preferred candidate has the following profile:

Trained technician with hands-on experience preferably from recovery and/or purification.
+2 years of experience from a production environment within the biopharmaceutical industry.
Experience working in a cGMP environment
Experience with process optimization (LEAN)
Interest in maintenance of equipment
Excellent collaboration- and communication skills
Ability to speak and write in English

As a person, you have a positive mind, are flexible and enjoys taking on new tasks and responsibilities. You thrive in a dynamic environment and can cope with uncertainties.
Our manufacturing teams are working in changing shifts 24/7, so you must be able to work flexible hours, both evening, nights and weekends.
AGC Biologics offersAGC Biologics offers a dynamic working place with good opportunities for working with a varied array of tasks and challenges. This opens many doors for personal development and for you to make a real difference towards both patients and customer. At AGC Biologics the work environment is informal and humor is part of the work day. We respect each other and our differences, and we help each other to reach deadlines together as one team.
For more information please contact teamleader Helle Bidstrup Jensen at +45 2294 3015
We will process the applications as they arrive. Therefore, please submit your application and CV as soon as possible. When the right candidates are found, the ad will close.
 
Danish version:
Vil du arbejde med det nyeste udstyr og teknologier, har du en baggrund som procesoperatør, procesteknolog eller en håndværksmæssig baggrund og trives du i et dynamisk miljø med et højt arbejdstempo? – så er denne stilling interessant for netop dig! 
AGC Biologics A/S er en ”Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization” (CDMO) indenfor biotekindustrien. Vi arbejder med udvikling af biofarmaceutiske produktionsprocesser samt GMP-produktion af biofarmaceutiske proteiner til både kliniske studier og markedet.
Om jobbet
Du bliver en del af vores produktionsområde, der består af fem produktionslinjer, der producerer præ-kliniske, kliniske og kommercielle produkter til en bred pallette af forskellige kunder. Teamet består af dedikerede teknikere og akademikere med en høj faglighed.
Som tekniker i vores mikrobielle Downstream team vil du være ansvarlig for at planlægge samt udføre de forskellige arbejdsgange i Recovery og Purification
Dit arbejde vil blandt andet omfatte:

Forberedelse til forskellige produktioner og systemer før og efter produktion, samt deltage i kvalificering, vedligeholdelse, kontrol og kalibrering af udstyret. herunder bestilling af varer.
Klargøring og kørsel af centrifuger, homogenisator, forskellige TFF systemer, filtreringer og andet både single use og traditionelle rensnings metoder.
Kørsel af UNICORN bioprocesser med alle slags kolonner
Pakning og test af alle slags kolonner.
Daglig prøvetagning.
Opsætte og køre CIP/SIP på forskelligt udstyr

Derud over vil du være ansvarlig for at sikre en høj standart i udfyldelse af vores GmP batch dokumentation, samt deltage i, vedligeholdelse, kontrol og kalibrering af udstyret.
Om dig
Vi forestiller os, at du:

Er uddannet procesoperatør eller procesteknolog.
Har +3 års erfaring fra den biopharmaceutiske industri og har arbejdet i et GMP miljø.
Har erfaring med kromatografi, UF/DF filtrering.
Er interesseret i vedligeholdelse af udstyr og redskaber.
Er god til at samarbejde og kommunikerer konstruktivt med andre.
Taler, læser og forstår engelsk (alle procedurer er på engelsk og arbejdssproget i organisationen er også engelsk) på minimum 9. klasses niveau.

Som person er du positiv og fleksibel og trives med at påtage dig nye opgaver og ansvar. Du trives i et dynamisk arbejdsmiljø og kan håndtere uforudsigeligheder i arbejdet. Du har et stort drive, er fuld af gåpåmod, er fleksibel og trives i et dynamisk arbejdsmiljø, hvor du med overblik håndterer flere opgaver samtidigt.
Vores produktionsteams kører i 3 hold skift, og du skal derfor være indstillet på at arbejde uden for normal arbejdstid, både weekender og helligdage.
For mere information, bedes du kontakte Teamleder Helle Bidstrup Jensen på +45 22943015
Vi gennemgår løbende ansøgninger, så send din ansøgning allerede i dag.
AGC Biologics
AGC tilbyder en dynamisk arbejdsplads med gode muligheder for at arbejde med en bred og varieret palet af opgaver og udfordringer. Du vil blive indviet i og få erfaring med måden, de forskellige afdelinger i en CDMO, samarbejder på for at opnå succes. AGC tilbyder et uformelt og humørfyldt arbejdsmiljø, som bærer præg af, at vi synes, det er sjovt at gå på arbejde. Vi respekterer hinanden og vores forskelligheder. AGC medarbejdere er fleksible og sætter en ære i at arbejde sammen om at nå vores mål – som ét team.

do you want to be part of a company helping customers bring new advanced biological products to market? and do you thrive in a role where you learn and develop? then these roles as a technician in our downstream team could be something for you.

as a microbial downstream technician, you will work in a gmp environment with batch execution, batch documentation and optimization of purification process flows. the downstream unit operations runs on heavy machinery such as centrifuges and homogenizers, and you will be part of cleanings as well as filtration, tff, chromatography and unicorn bioprocesses. in this role, you will work on the floor during production and be engaged securing batch readiness and release and you will take part in the maintenance of equipment.

trained technician with hands-on experience preferably from recovery and/or purification.

interest in maintenance of equipment

Business Analyst

A2i Systems A/S
 Copenhagen

Indrykket 10. marts 2022



 If you thrive in a fast paced, agile, international and customer focused work environment, then we have just the job for you! 

Who are we and what do we do?

 A2i is a full stack vertical AI company solely focusing on developing and marketing PriceCast Fuel - the world’s only AI-first, industry-specific, retail fuel pricing decision and optimization system. PriceCast Fuel applies AI to Big Data in a real-time, data-driven system - elevating pricing in organizations from being tactical to strategic. PriceCast Fuel reaches targets by continuously predicting demands in volatile markets by forecasting customer behavior amongst others. 


 We are 19 employees with a fast-growing customer base throughout Europe and North America and we are planning to add several new faces in the next months at our offices in Copenhagen and Odense. 


 You can read more about us at www.a2isystems.com. 

So where do you come in?

 As we are growing our customer base, we need to be capable to deliver more advice, insights, and inspiration through cutting edge analyses and stunning visual analytics. Although our product PriceCast Fuel delivers fully automated decision making, our Professional Services assists our customers in the transition from tactical- to strategic workflows. 


 The types of analyses we perform ranges from micro- to macro market and helps to both make sure that PriceCast Fuel is configured optimally as well as giving an insight into where the overall market is heading. 


 We need your help to scale our capability to deliver business analytics services and advice. You will join a team that works internationally with customers all over the globe. Typically, we have bi-weekly/monthly remote meetings with every customer, and we meet face to face twice per year, so we expect that you are comfortable with some international travelling, that is when it will be possible again to travel. 

Tasks you can expect

Create analytical reports based on customers data
Extracting, processing, cleaning, and verifying the integrity of data used for analytical, statistical, and visualization purposes
Present the analysis and advice internally and to the customers during the meetings
Data quality assurance to ensure valid data
Keep current analytical reports up-to-date and continuously improve them
Build and maintain Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) frameworks
Drawing insights across data and data feeds
Support the customers to use the product more efficiently by data collection and analytical inputs or suggestions
Develop and provide data models (for example anomaly detection, market patterns discovery, spatial modelling)
Support customers in solving their concerns by contributing to customer meetings
Create and maintain custom Qlik Sense reports

What do we expect from you?

Previous work experiences the field of business analytics with tools and techniques such as SQL, Python, Jupyter, Pandas and Qlik Sense
You are fully confident in presenting your analyses to a C-level audience and are skilled at creating engaging presentations
Speaking and writing in English is second nature to you. You might even master a couple of other languages as well
For at least 4 years you have been working in a similar role.
You have a master’s degree or equivalent in software engineering or computer science
Good analytics and engineering practices, e.g. reproducibility, version control, and documentation
When presented with challenges you act rather than wait for instructions.
You have an analytical mindset and can easily understand business problems and logic and come up with solutions
It comes easy to you, putting yourself in the client’s shoes and understanding their point of view, while at the same time being able to explain how the problem can be solved in a different way whilst still giving them what they want.
Being able to travel to meet with clients, one to two times per month – when business travel will be viable once again

What would be nice from you?

 Life is a journey – and we’re all still learning something new every day. But it would be nice if you already have: 


Extended tool experience from the business analytics domain, such as Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Azure Data Studio
Extended knowledge and experience from AI modelling
Knowledge and experience from working with agile methodologies
Working experience from the retail fuel industry


 If none of this complies? Don’t worry – you can still learn it! 

Taking the next step…

 The location of this position is at our office in Copenhagen, close to the airport. Although we see working together at the office as a strength which sparks innovation and embraces sparring, we do support flexible working hours and the opportunity of working from home during the week. We also offer an attractive package including several employee benefits such as pension scheme, health insurance, canteen, free snacks and fruit and all the coffee you can drink. 


 Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible via the button below. If you have any questions about the position, please contact job@a2isystems.com.

			Data Architect 
			


Data and digitalisation drives change. Change in lives of those who have – and those who have not. Access to reliable, trusted, credible, safeguarded data from those we assist, from the processes we manage, from and to our donors and the partners we work with are foundational for acting with agility in the volatile time we find ourselves in.
Can you lead our data architecture strategy as well as our day-to-day BI environments? Ensure that we acquire, process, store, access data in a safe and robust manner thereby maximise its value to the organisation? Can you guide us to technology and partner choices which paves the way for us to directly contribute to the aspiration of DRC Strategy 2025? This is your opportunity to make a global impact on the agenda of providing every displaced person a dignified life!
Who are we?
The Danish Refugee Council works in hotspots in 40 countries. Over the past years we have had a tremendous growth internationally. Successful ideation, development and benefit realisation from new and existing solutions are key objectives in DRC to ensure we continue to provide efficient security and protection to the people we serve. We balance this with our delivery of seamless collaboration platforms for our colleagues in need of flexibility to perform their tasks and collaborate globally irrespective time and place and a robust and expanding ERP platform in Microsoft Dynamics.
About the job
You will be a key resource in the journey towards a data driven organisation. The chosen technology is the MS tech stack with end user focus on using Power BI for the presentation layer. You will work in a dedicated BI team managing the challenging tasks of:

Lead the creation, maintenance, and use of data models, in collaboration with key stakeholders
Building and supporting a global network of BI specialists
Drive adoption of core elements of Data Governance and Master Data Management
Deploying Power BI in DRC globally

Liaising with and facilitating onboarding new business areas and regional/country unis 
Designing data solutions based on business requirements finding solutions to progress where data gaps are present


Ensuring that solutions are optimised for the Power BI Premium platform 
Governance structures supporting optimal use of PBI – including user and data access management
Facilitating synergies in data modelling towards broader aspect of data and digitalisation both within the Power Platform and in other advanced and more explorative data use cases. 

About you
To be successful in this role we expect you to have at least 5 years documented experience setting standard for the role as Data Architect. You convey opportunities and constraints within your area of expertise to less technically savvy colleagues with patience and appreciation. You have in depth knowledge of technologies driving the digital transformation and guide colleagues and stakeholders toward successful application of them.
You navigate seamlessly between key IT functional areas bringing enough knowledge on Information Security, IT Project Management, Application Management, Enterprise Architecture, IT Service and Operations, and IT Strategy development to liaise and engage across these critical IT contributions with ease.
All employees should master DRC's core competencies: Communicating, Taking the lead, Collaborating, Striving for excellence, and Demonstrating integrity.
Moreover, we also expect the following:
Required 

Hold an academic degree in Computer Science or equivalent
5 years of professional experience in the role of Data Architect
Have strong analytical and reporting skills
Technical skills to act as accountable owner of DRC Data Architecture
Show strong and inclusive interpersonal skills
Have strong oral and written communication skills.
Fluency in written and spoken English.

Desirable

NGO-experience
Power BI expertise
Experience working in global and cross functional teams
Knowledge of French and Danish is desirable.

We offer
A great physical workplace in central Copenhagen easily accessible by public transport. While we trust that meeting physically strengthens common culture, innovation power, relationships and collaboration, we offer the opportunity to flexibly work from home when the tasks do not require presence in the office. We are a global organisation where virtual is the norm.
Contract length: Permanent
Workplace: Borgergade 10, Copenhagen, Denmark
Start date: When the right candidate is identified
Salary and conditions will be in accordance with agreement between the Danish Confederation of Professional Associates (AC-organisationerne) and the Danish Refugee Council. The position is at “specialkonsulent/”senior consultant” level. This is contractually a national position for which local Danish terms and conditions apply.
Application process
All applicants must send a cover letter and an updated CV in English. Apply online on our page Current Vacancies at www.drc.ngo. 
Closing date for applications: 31 March 2022. Due to the urgency in filling this role, we will conduct interviews on a running basis.
Further information
For questions regarding the vacancy please contact Steffen Kølbek, CIO and Global Head of IT.
For further information about the Danish Refugee Council, please consult our website https://drc.ngo




DRC as an employer

By working in DRC, you will be joining a global workforce of around 8000 employees in 40 countries. We pride ourselves on our:

Professionalism, impact & expertise 
Humanitarian approach & the work we do
Purpose, meaningfulness & own contribution
Culture, values & strong leadership
Fair compensation & continuous development


DRC’s capacity to ensure the protection of and assistance to refugees, IDP’s and other persons of concern depends on the ability of our staff to uphold and promote the highest standards of ethical and professional conduct in relation DRC’s values and Code of Conduct, including safeguarding against sexual exploitation, abuse and harassment. DRC conducts thorough and comprehensive background checks as part of the recruitment process. 


If you have questions or are facing problems with the online application process, please visit drc.ngo/about-us/job-and-career/support-for-job-seekers.
Danish Refugee Council is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive and positive work environment based on mutual respect for all employees. All applicants are considered for employment without attention to race, age, ability, ethnicity, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other factor. At DRC we celebrate diversity and appreciate our employees for the people they are and their unique skills, backgrounds, and perspectives. We encourage all interested candidates to apply!

DRC (Danish Refugee Council), founded in Denmark in 1956, is Denmark’s largest and the world’s leading non-profit, independent, rights-based refugee organization.

We protect lives and human rights and empower beneficiaries throughout conflict displacement by providing shelter, food, and hope in terms of work, education and integration towards a sustainable future.

expert within software development? And are you motivated by working in a
dynamic, start-up environment with colleagues that are dedicated and want to
translate world-class research into commercial projects?If yes,
then keep reading, as we are looking for a Full Stack Software Developer to
join the SpaceM Bio Studio Project at the BioInnovation Institute (BII).BII’s
mission is to create new life science solutions to address unmet societal or
health needs. As part of this mission, BII has established a new program, Bio
Studio, which aims to build life science start-ups based on world class
research. Bio Studio projects are sourced in from leading researchers employed
at research institutions around the world. The projects we admit combine
scientific novelty, commercial viability, and the potential for significant
societal and/or health impact. The goal of the projects is to create a viable
start-up company based on the project within 3 years. BII aims to
recruit a strong project team for each Bio Studio project. It is expected that
this team will form the core of the future start-up created from the project.
Apart from establishing a strong Project Team, BII provides a comprehensive
network of industry, investors, and subject of matter experts to support the
projects.The JobThe SpaceM project aims to develop and
commercialize single-cell metabolomics technology for drug discovery and
precision medicine. The project PI is Dr. Theodore Alexandrov from European
Molecular Biology Laboratory (Heidelberg) who is world leader in single-cell
metabolomics and was previously co-founder of an imaging mass spectrometry
startup. Dr. Alexandrov’s team at EMBL has developed the foundational
technology that allows measuring levels of drugs or metabolites inside single
cells. This information can be of high value for both fundamental understanding
of cellular responses and as a tool for drug development. The SpaceM project
will further develop the technology to reduce costs and increase throughput.You will join a dynamic team of talented
and experienced scientists and engineers excited to make translational impact
through development of novel technologies. We offer a start-up culture focused
on efficiency and collaborative work with minimal hierarchy and bureaucracy yet
with professional approach to project management. Moreover, integration of the
project team in the BioInnovation Institute Bio Studio provides attractive and
competitive work conditions, multiple learning opportunities, and involvement
in a vibrant entrepreneurial network.You will be responsible for the following:Developing software implementing custom algorithms and visualization approaches for single-cell omicsWorking together with experimentalists to formulate requirements and user storiesWorking together with data scientists developing novel algorithms and further integrate them into softwareMaintaining infrastructureSupporting internal users of the softwareYou will
report directly to the CIO of BII, Trine Bartholdy. This role is based on a
3-year contract, with the possibility of an extension.About YouOur ideal candidate has an MSc in software
engineering, computer science, or a few years of relevant working experience
within this area. Strong experience in Python is a prerequisite. It is also
important that you have experience with both frontend and backend development
as well as with developing graphical user interfaces.In addition, you have:Experience of working alone or in a small team in the role of full stack developerKnowledge of principles of data analysisExperience in or knowledge of machine learning, image analysis, or omics data analysis is desirableExperience in or knowledge of single-cell data analysis is a plusKnowledge of napari is beneficialExperience of working with experimental scientists to jointly formulate software requirements and user stories is a plusExperience of working with data scientists to support algorithms developments and to jointly develop software based on a prototype implementation is a plusAs a person, you are passionate about software
development and are driven to continuously develop your skills and knowledge.
You are also interested in science and working closely together with scientists,
and motivated by working in a dynamic, start-up environment. Working at BIIWe offer a committed and professional workplace in which we emphasize ensuring that our colleagues thrive, are challenged and have opportunities to develop their potential. A career at BII gives you the opportunity to work:on building the largest innovation and incubation initiative within the Life Sciences in Denmark;  with key actors within research and development; and as part of a dedicated team that is passionate about creating value for society.BioInnovation Institute provides you with an opportunity to become part of a vibrant and professional workplace with a chance to bring ideas to life and science to market for the benefit for society and human welfare. Application and InformationFor more information, please contact Trine Bartholdy, Chief Innovation Officer on e-mail: tba@bii.dk or phone: +45 2277 8551. We encourage you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than 15/04/2022.To apply, please send your CV, cover letter, and university transcripts by clicking on the “Apply now” button.About the BioInnovation Institute FoundationThe
BioInnovation Institute foundation (BII) is an international commercial
foundation with a nonprofit objective supported by the Novo Nordisk Foundation.
BII operates an incubator to accelerate world-class life science innovation
that drives the development of new solutions by early life science start-ups
for the benefit of people and society.BII,
located in Copenhagen, Denmark, offers start-ups and early-stage projects
within health tech, therapeutics and bioindustrials state-of-the-art labs,
vibrant office facilities, business development, start-up business incubation,
access to high-level mentoring and international networks, plus unique funding
opportunities of up to 1.3 million euro per start-up and 2.4 million euro per
project.Since the
inauguration of BII in November 2018, BII has awarded 35 million euros to 68
high-growth start-up companies. Read more on www.bioinnovationinstitute.com  Apply nowShare Save Job

Development Chemist – Route Design
 
We are looking for an outstanding synthetic chemist to join the department of Route Design, as a Process Chemist. This offers a great opportunity to be part of a great team and become a Process Chemist in the Department of Route Design at the Lundbeck Research Centre in Copenhagen Denmark (DK), and help develop new medicines to treat Central Nervous System (CNS) diseases. 
 
Route Design is a key component of Process Chemistry, which is part of the Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls (CMC) organization in Copenhagen Denmark (DK), where our goal is to develop new synthetic routes of novel Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API). The area of Process Chemistry is fully integrated encompassing Route Scouting, Process Optimization, Scale Up, Safety assessment, and GMP manufacture.
 
Your job and key responsibilities
As a Process Chemist in the Department of Route Design you will be involved in many aspects of the development value chain. You will be working in a strong team environment within Route Design. As a skilled Synthetic Organic Chemist, you will have an excellent opportunity to directly impact our development programs through design of novel syntheses of compounds coming from Research. Focusing on developing new synthetic processes for API formation, which are directly transferable to further scale up, due to their inherent robust, scalable, safe, and environmentally acceptable character. Furthermore, the job also includes synthesis of e.g. metabolites, impurities, and PET precursors either directly or via the support of CRO’s. You will be working in a strong team environment and the role will allow you to learn the trade of process chemistry.
 
We offer
A unique opportunity to further develop your skill set in synthetic organic chemistry and learn process chemistry principles in a leading CNS specialized drug development CMC organization.
 
Qualifications and competencies
Our preferred candidate has the following personal and professional attributes:

You have a PhD in synthetic organic chemistry, potentially supplemented by postdoctoral studies
You have a proven track record in planning, developing, and enabling multistep organic syntheses  
You are innovative, thorough, and can envision and execute successful synthetic chemistry strategies
You thrive in a Team environment of shared goals and responsibilities
Excellent communication skills; ability to develop, implement, and clearly communicate chemistry strategies to team, management and collaborators in English language

 
Further information
For further information, please contact Michael H. Rock, Director of Process Chemistry on MIHR@lundbeck.com or +45 30 83 33 23. Your application and CV should not be sent via email.
 
We also recommend that you have a look at our website.
 
Your application
Please click on the link below to apply for the job. Applications must be received no later than April 1st and should include a cover letter with curriculum vitae as well as the names and contact details for two referees. Please note that applicants will be reviewed at an ongoing basis and therefore the advert may close prior to the deadline if we have proceeded with candidates to the interview phase.
 













Lundbeck is a global pharmaceutical company specialized in brain diseases. For more than 70 years, we have been at the forefront of neuroscience research. We are tirelessly dedicated to restoring brain health, so every person can be their best. 
Billions of people worldwide live with brain diseases – complex conditions often invisible to others that nonetheless take a tremendous toll on individuals, families and societies. We are committed to fighting stigma and discrimination against people living with brain diseases and advocating for broader social acceptance of people with brain health conditions. Every day, we strive for improved treatment and a better life for people living with brain disease.  
We have approximately 5,600 employees in more than 50 countries, and our products are available in more than 100 countries. Our research programs tackle some of the most complex challenges in neuroscience, and our pipeline is focused on bringing forward transformative treatments for which there are few, if any therapeutic options. We have research facilities in Denmark and the United States, and our production facilities are located in Denmark, France, and Italy. Lundbeck generated revenue of DKK 17.7 billion in 2020 (EUR 2.4 billion; USD 2.7 billion). 
For additional information, we encourage you to visit our corporate site www.lundbeck.com and connect with us on Instagram (h_lundbeck), Twitter at @Lundbeck and via LinkedIn.

development chemist – route design
we are looking for an outstanding synthetic chemist to join the department of route design, as a process chemist. this offers a great opportunity to be part of a great team and become a process chemist in the department of route design at the lundbeck research centre in copenhagen denmark (dk), and help develop new medicines to treat central nervous system (cns) diseases.
route design is a key component of process chemistry, which is part of the chemistry, manufacturing, and controls (cmc) organization in copenhagen denmark (dk), where our goal is to develop new synthetic routes of novel active pharmaceutical ingredients (api). the area of process chemistry is fully integrated encompassing route scouting, process optimization, scale up, safety assessment, and gmp manufacture.
your job and key responsibilities
as a process chemist in the department of route design you will be involved in many aspects of the development value chain. you will be working in a strong team environment within route design. as a skilled synthetic organic chemist, you will have an excellent opportunity to directly impact our development programs through design of novel syntheses of compounds coming from research. focusing on developing new synthetic processes for api formation, which are directly transferable to further scale up, due to their inherent robust, scalable, safe, and environmentally acceptable character. furthermore, the job also includes synthesis of e.g. metabolites, impurities, and pet precursors either directly or via the support of cro’s. you will be working in a strong team environment and the role will allow you to learn the trade of process chemistry.
a unique opportunity to further develop your skill set in synthetic organic chemistry and learn process chemistry principles in a leading cns specialized drug development cmc organization.
our preferred candidate has the following personal and professional attributes:
you have a phd in synthetic organic chemistry, potentially supplemented by postdoctoral studies
you have a proven track record in planning, developing, and enabling multistep organic syntheses
you are innovative, thorough, and can envision and execute successful synthetic chemistry strategies
you thrive in a team environment of shared goals and responsibilities
excellent communication skills; ability to develop, implement, and clearly communicate chemistry strategies to team, management and collaborators in english language
we also recommend that you have a look at our website.
lundbeck is a global pharmaceutical company specialized in brain diseases. for more than 70 years, we have been at the forefront of neuroscience research. we are tirelessly dedicated to restoring brain health, so every person can be their best.
billions of people worldwide live with brain diseases – complex conditions often invisible to others that nonetheless take a tremendous toll on individuals, families and societies. we are committed to fighting stigma and discrimination against people living with brain diseases and advocating for broader social acceptance of people with brain health conditions. every day, we strive for improved treatment and a better life for people living with brain disease.
we have approximately 5,600 employees in more than 50 countries, and our products are available in more than 100 countries. our research programs tackle some of the most complex challenges in neuroscience, and our pipeline is focused on bringing forward transformative treatments for which there are few, if any therapeutic options. we have research facilities in denmark and the united states, and our production facilities are located in denmark, france, and italy. lundbeck generated revenue of dkk 17.7 billion in 2020 (eur 2.4 billion; usd 2.7 billion).

text:
Country Associate - Germany
Are you passionate about e-commerce, customer experience, and obsessed with bringing the most advanced and natural products to market? And do you speak German?Scandinavian Biolabs is a rapidly growing online business based in Copenhagen. With the use of  natural and vegan ingredients, we advocate innovation through plant-based ingredients and full transparency when it comes to how and where we are producing our products.All components in the hair growth formulas are carefully chosen due to the simple fact that they are natural, healthy, and scientifically proven successful in regenerating hair and by increasing activity in the follicles.We are growing at a fast pace and are currently expanding to markets such as Germany. Hence, we are looking for an ambitious and German-speaking Country Associate with a passion for running business development projects, taking great care of our customers and pursuing off-line channels to improve access to our products working directly with our CCO.Responsibilities:   This position is an opportunity to be a part of an innovative, fast-growing company. As our new team member, you will be working closely with the rest of the team and contribute with giving German specific input to our B2C business with our CGO, executing on our digital strategy and work directly with our CCO in executing an ambitious B2B strategy.Furthermore, you will be working from our Copenhagen office that we share with other ambitious and fast-growing start-ups providing a highly dynamic and entrepreneurial environment as well as an excellent platform for personal development and knowledge-sharing.What are we promising?~15 hours a week with competitive salary and bonus; possibility for more hours/full-time position after ~3 monthsYoung, dynamic team of marketing wizards, strategists, product development professionals, ex-management consultants, Amazon experts and much, much moreWorking directly with our Chief Commercial Officer, Chief Growth Officer and Head of Customer Care to develop our German offering across channelsInvestment in your development and the ability to be responsible for a critical part of our growth journeyFlexible working set-up; while we prefer you to be on-site as much as possible (especially because of our great team!), remote working days are completely fineFlexible hours; we understand that you are likely studying or enjoying other commitments, so we are flexible on timing as wellWhat are we looking for?A collaborative thinker who excels in teams while also being independent and self-drivenCreative and entrepreneurial spiritFluent in GermanPreferably studying in Copenhagen – e.g. BLC, IB, HA or other any other degrees at CBS, KU, DTU, etc.If you have an interest in health, hair, e-commerce, customer experiences and developing a growing market, as well as being part of developing a high-growth company, we would love to hear from you.Please include CV, 10-15 lines about you and your motivation and any other documents you think are relevant.

text:
Community Success Coordinator Nordics - Music Startup 
We are looking for a community success team member aka a people's person to join our team in Copenhagen. A person who want to support and grow our community in the Nordics currently counting 17K members incl. artists and music lovers hosting and going to concerts.About the roleYou will be a key player in our community team - taking care of daily communication and support on SoMe channels, e-mail and phone. Our mantra is help-to-self-help and we believe in taking the time to understand and educate our community to make us and them better. Simply put, the less they need our help, the more successful we are.The keys to success in this role will be your curiosity to understand the user journeys and pain points on the road. Identify patterns by collecting and analyzing user insights and actively use this to develop and improve customer success in Low-Fi - but also advocate for our community with the rest of the team incl. product and marketing.This means that you get excited about analyzing conversion and engagement rates and constantly look for ways to ensure that our community get the information they need at the right point in time. You're data-driven and will be encouraged to experiment, measure and iterate our one-to-many communication (think: events, video guides, email campaigns, webinars ... )Your ResponsibilitiesBe a trusted advisor and product specialist of the Low-Fi platform and its usage for hosts, artists and guestsCoordinate and run community activities incl. campaigns, events, educational sessionsCollaborate cross-functionally with C-level, Product and Marketing by being the voice of the community and championing their needs and pains.Challenge status-quo to improve how we do community success in Low-FiWhat we look forPassion for people with a user-centric and service-oriented personalityExperience from working with customer success / support / education or similarExcellent communication skills: both written and verbalFluent in English and at least one Nordic language (DK, SE and/or NO)  Outstanding interpersonal skills and experience building internal and external relationshipsOperational discipline with an analytical, process-oriented mindset and a data-based approach to decision making and assessmentHands on experience with CRM and CS systems ( Mailchimp and Hubspot will be a ++)Who we areWe are a startup based in Copenhagen NV with a team of ten international, fun and ambitious human beings and 'our' office dog Katzu.We are not a “sit at your desk 37 hours a week” workplace. We are not focused on how many hours you spend in front of the computer, but what results you achieve. We believe in a diverse team with different backgrounds, interests and work-life balance. Whether this position is full time or part time is negotiable, but we imagine it to be a minimum of 25 hours per week.Team treatsFlexible working hoursTeam event in and outside officeFree Low-Fi concert ticketsBubbles and cake on a regular basis, as we love to celebrate our wins and learningsJoin a movementJoining Low-Fi you will be a part of something bigger than yourself. You will become a full member of a global DIY live music scene, where the close proximity between artist and audience creates a special atmosphere that allows everyone to drop their guard and create meaningful connections with the music and each other. We call this amplified togetherness.If you are thinking that this is exactly the opportunity you have been looking for, then send us your application with a cover letter and CV. If you have any questions, feel free to contact Stine Hulvej Heegaard.NB! Start date is asap. This can be either part time or full time depending on the candidate. We'll run interviews as we get applications.

text:
Head of Product Marketing
Rokoko is a category leading brand, providing motion capture and animation tools for the global entertainment industry. Our customers include top tier game, film, AR/VR and VFX producers as well as thousands of indie creators making unique content. Our vision is to enable every creator to be able to do 3D animation - intuitively, collaboratively, and fast! We are looking for an experienced and passionate Head of Product Marketing to join our growing Growth Team in our Copenhagen office, reporting to the Director of Growth.The Head of Product Marketing role is to accelerate the growth of an industry leading desktop SaaS built for animators, by championing the customer's perspective, communicating product value, and driving adoption among the right segments of users by leading GTM campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a track record within early-stage SaaS product marketing, where product launches, feature positioning, and end-to-end marketing activities are native to you. This is a unique opportunity to join a category leading brand working with some of the biggest film, game, and animation studios, including Netflix, Epic, Disney and others.Responsibilities:As we develop new software products and features to better serve and access new customers, you will play a leading role in determining the GTM strategy and how we scale sales.You'll utilise product marketing frameworks to own positioning, lead cross-functional product and feature launch processes, covering acquisition through to advocacy.You'll be the main liaison between product, marketing, and C-level on everything to do with product and feature launches.You'll partner with cross-functional management to nurture and establish product partnerships.You'll nurture industry understanding and continuously evaluate how ecosystem players interact with each other and the role we play. Likewise, you'll be responsible for the enablement of other commercial teams, acting as an internal product, customer, and industry expert.You'll partner with our in-house content team to develop compelling and useful content to educate existing and prospective customers.You'll be responsible for hiring and building our product marketing function covering both hardware and software.RequirmentsAt least 5 years experience in early-stage SaaS, with a proven track record of product marketing or management.Demonstrated ability to operate in cross-functional environments where you're comfortable navigating multiple responsibilities, technical conversations, and customer types.Demonstrated experience drawing logical conclusions from data to inform decision making.Experience working or taking interest in the creative industry and a familiarity with creative tools is preferred.Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills.You're a natural leader who takes pride in your work and feels a sense of ownership and accountability in the outcomes you drive.

User Engagement Lead
Stay awhile and listen, User Engagement LeadAre you an avid gamer and the person who can make 1.000.000 users per month feel seen and heard - then please read on…YOU AND TROPHY GAMESTrophy Games went public on First North a year ago, and the ambitions for the coming years are high. We strive to put Trophy Games on the map globally, with our own developed games and by acquiring game studios with great potential and synergies. “Exceptional games made by happy employees for engaged users” is our organizational DNA here at Trophy Games and for the coming journey, we’re looking for the person who can take our current Customer Service operations and transform it into a User Engagement ‘movement’. The job is a full-time position ideally covered from our wonderful Copenhagen office.VISION FOR THE FUTURE - FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE TO USER ENGAGEMENTWe want to change the focus, and name, of our 1 ½ person strong Customer Service team, to User Engagement.In order to reflect the “engaged user” part of our DNA more vividly, we want to ad to the scope of the team so it’s not only a matter of being reactive to user contacts (which it still needs to be), but also to be proactive in:Engaging users across our games, wherever they areBe to link between the users of a game and the inhouse development team, by relaying user input and observations to the teamBe proactive in our user engagementEstablish superuser and expert foraFacilitate excellent user experience across contact pointsBe the inhouse user advocate The details in how to achieve the best possible user experience and engagement across our games, is obviously not fully listed above; the important part is not HOW user engagement and satisfaction is strengthened, but that it’s achieved - and that’s where you as “User Engagement Lead” comes into the picture!Alongside the new and proactive user engagement measures, the good old customer service tasks are still important as well. To get an understanding of what you’ll also be dealing with as our new User Engagement Lead, please read the appendix “Description of a Customer Service day” carefully.WORKING AT TROPHY GAMESYou will join our great team of +40 geeky and creative professionals on a mission to make games people want to play for decades. We have an office filled with awesome people, lots of coffee (and beer!) and great vibes - which is basically all you need to create awesome games! To create games, we play games, we discuss and invent, and then we are pretty good at celebrating. Some of the other perks of working at Trophy Games are the location in the center of Copenhagen, a flexible working schedule and the possibility to work from home when needed. This creates the perfect work-life balance and carve out time for your kids, friends and personal side projects. We favor diversity and embrace individuality and different backgrounds. We strive to create a relaxed and comfortable environment where everyone is encouraged to be their authentic selves.ARE YOU UP FOR THE JOB?No later than March 27th, send your portfolio, CV and cover letterIf you want to know more before doing that, please contact Theis Dinesen at +45 2323 0818 We're excitedly awaiting your application…AppendixDescription of a Customer Service day General description of a day in the life of the Customer Service lead in the current setup:A typical day starts by checking Facebook. We’ll go through Facebook groups and check for posts and membership requests. After that we’ll check for Facebook messages. After that we’ll do support via Helpshift and mail. Then we’ll check and reply to app reviews on all our titles both on GooglePlay and AppStore. We also monitor and engage with users via Discord for the relevant titles.Currently, around 50% of the day is used to answer contacts from users/customers. Han skulle kun have været ude i den næste ligakamp, ikke tre i træk.Good morning, Miss Anja. text:
Product Designer
We believe design matters. We believe great design feels magical. We believe design is a key element to success. We hope to find someone with the same beliefs, that can help us make Weld even better across all our digital platforms. Our journey has just started, so now is your chance to really make an impact and jump on this early-stage growth train.We're searching for a master of Figma, a design advocate for good design and last but not least just another great colleague to join us on this journey. We're moving fast and love creative problem-solvers that can not only do pixel perfect designs but also create low fidelity prototypes for quick iterations. You'll be working in our product team, helping bring our digital platforms to the next level. You'll be given ownership of our digital identity, and be instrumental in the evolution of our digital design and platforms, so when we say you will have an impact, we really mean it.The nitty-gritty skills needed;Extensive experience within UI/UX Design or a degree in a design related disciplineThorough understanding of visual and user-centered designUnderstanding of business objectives and how UI design meets branding workExperience scoping project work and defining timelinesExperience creating dynamic/responsive design systems (Figma) with shared library assetsWe’d be thrilled if you;Have some experience with transitions and motion designHave a keen interest in current trends within design and communicationAre obsessed with the finer detailBasic understanding of codingHave prior experience working in a SaaS companyYour friends say you’re;Independent but also a team player 💪🏼Thrive in an environment of change and growthSomeone who you would love to have a coffee withKnows how to lift up the mood :-)Nerdy about something that you absolutely love. Could be everything from making the best tiramisu or having a side-gig as a plant mom/dadWhat’s in it for you?Work with a bunch of fun, positive and entrepreneurial individualsCompetitive salary and equity packageFully-remote work (within 6 hours of CET) wherever you want, or work in a beautiful and spacious office in central Copenhagen. Whatever you prefer25 days paid vacationFlexible work: working from home when you want, where you want, why you want toLoads of fun events and activities to join (we're talking game nights, wakeboarding, Friday bars, and yoga)Some nice things that we do ❤️You get your own Pleo card (company card) for no out-of-pocket spending, and full autonomyFree lunch everyday and breakfast on Monday mornings together with the team (if you work from the office)Team camps around the world – remotes are flown in (around once a quarter) for team building and learning (hurry up and apply already so we can bring you to the next one!)Our teamToday, we are a team of 35+ people spread around the world (Canada, Germany, Spain, Ireland, Ukraine and Denmark) – with our HQ in Copenhagen. We're generalists; each with our expertise and constantly picking up new challenges as well as giving a helping hand wherever needed. We're looking for people who are eager to learn and who are not afraid of building things end-to-end. We want to find curious people who can pick up a given problem and solve it. We want entrepreneurial minds to join us, who excel in the early stages of a fast-growing company.Our missionWe fundamentally believe that structured and organized customer data can be transformational to business success. We are on a mission to help every company in the world become data-driven. This enhances efficiency, productivity, decision-making and customer happiness.How we workWe focus highly on creating a culture that's vibrant, fun, exciting and challenging. We’re achieving this by having an extremely talented and passionate team, who fundamentally believes that we're better together. We value ownership and you can expect to be given a lot of freedom and responsibility, while we work closely together as a team.We're remote-friendly and strive to make sure that we create the best office and remote experience. text:
Director of Product Management
Linkfire is looking for a full-time Director of Product Management in Copenhagen who can bring our fast-growing product team to the next level and support our mission to create value through data. You will join us in continuing to discover and deliver new and exciting features for the 300 million fans we bring closer to their favourite artists every month.You will join a company with roots and heart in music. We’re a team of designers, engineers, product managers and more, drawn from every corner of the globe. Your team will consist of product managers working across multiple cross-functional, agile teams.The common denominator? Music - we live and breathe the stuff.You will report to our Head of Product.The RoleWe’re looking for an experienced product leader to join our journey, help us grow, and lead our Product Management team. As Director of Product management, you will lead and evolve product strategy, go-to-market considerations, people management/development and require close collaborations with our leaders of Engineering, Data, Design, and Marketing along with our Head of Product on strategy and execution of the roadmap. You will be the subject matter expert overseeing product development operations to ensure smooth flow and efficiency, devise strategies to improve processes while honing in existing processes, improving overall team performance, and create consensus throughout the entire organisation. What you will doCollaborate with design, data and engineering leaders to set goals and expectations and support all teams in succeedingSet and drive the agenda for improvement and the change you want to see for product development at LinkfireLead your teams through the ideation, development, and launch of new productsEmpower your team members by trusting them with tasks and projects according to their expertise and ambitionsEnsure a culture of transparency and knowledge sharing through available and useful documentation and workshopsAdvocate for product-led growth and mature product discovery and delivery across the whole organisationRecruit new employees and onboard new colleagues to the teamsWork in close collaboration with HR on individual development and speak on behalf of your team on general team well-beingYour qualifications5+ years of experience within a Product Management functionExperience in the tech start-up industry (data-focused roles is a major advantage)People management experience of at least small teams; capability to grow a healthy and effective teamYou have experience in leading and managing individual contributors, ideally in a fast-growing startup environmentYou have a strong technical background, e.g. you have been a technical product manager, analyst or engineer before adventuring into managementYou know what it means to achieve high-performance teamsYou are able to identify challenges and find solutions for yourself and your teamYou communicate clearly, listen, show empathy and can coach others to do the sameYou are proficient with a broad range of technologies and able to acquire new ones quicklyYou actively share knowledge and encourage others to do soExperience working with data products is a big plus!What we offerDevelopment of people management and leadership skillsLearning opportunities in the areas of mentoring and coachingThe opportunity to create must-have products for the music and entertainment industryAn open, informal entrepreneurial startup working environmentFlexible hours, work from home when you need toA monthly well-being budget and employee health benefitsAn awesome, international office with colleagues from 25+ different nationalitiesGreat working location, company lunch, Friday bars, concerts in the office, and much moreAbout usLinkfire was founded as a response to the increasingly complex nature of digital music marketing. Listeners the world over are streaming through different services—so how do you connect to all of them at once, simply and smartly? Our technology links fans directly to the content they love in their favorite app. At the same time, we empower everyone from major labels to independent artists with unparalleled audience insights. Since we started, we’ve become a trusted partner to the music industry’s biggest names, as well as thousands of soon-to-be biggest names. We’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with offices in NYC, LA and Lisbon. Every day we help artists we adore to realize their potential through the power of music data. Underpinning our culture is collaborative, agile processes, and something we like to call the ‘Nordic spirit.’ It means working together with transparency, respect, and honesty. And that goes for the way we do business, too.How we workMusic has the unique power to unite us all. It transcends cultures, languages, and borders. Every day, we help artists from around the world connect with their fans, and we’re immensely proud to count such a diverse range of creators as our users. We embrace this diversity inside our offices too. At Linkfire, we want you to find a place to belong, and feel encouraged to be your authentic self. We therefore do not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected classification or status. If this is you, then please send us your CV and application in English. We will review applications and interview on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait.If this is you, send in your resume in English to get started. We are constantly reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait - Apply!

Senior Product Designer
GAN is transforming the way the world’s leading corporations deal with corruption, compliance, and regulatory risk. We provide compliance professionals around the globe with a powerful, intuitive software platform for managing all their compliance activities in one place. Our leading all-in-one, no-code SaaS compliance and risk platform, empowers organizations to do the right thing and conduct their business with the highest ethical standards.Our OpportunityWe are looking for a Senior Product Designer who is passionate about designing intuitive solutions to help solve complex problems for our customers. At GAN, you will be contributing to building our enterprise compliance platform using our internal design system, which you will continue to evolve. You are interested in design culture and you like to keep an eye on the field’s best practices.Responsibilities includeAs our new Senior Product Designer, you will be working in a cross-functional and multi-disciplinary team of highly skilled and dedicated people to deliver solutions and services to our enterprise customers. In collaboration with the rest of the product and design team, you will help set the direction for our enterprise compliance platform.Your tasks will include:Undertaking product discovery in collaboration with product managers, engineers and researchers, and other designers.Visualizing and communicating design ideas using storyboards, process flows, sitemaps and user journey maps, etc.Creating mockups, visuals, or high fidelity prototypes to test ideas with customers and stakeholdersDesigning user interface elements and contributing to our internal design system for use in our product development effortsPreparing and presenting rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders and leading the customer feedback activitiesIdentifying and troubleshooting design problems and work to continuously to eliminate design debtIterating designs based on external and internal feedbackUnderstanding, using, and contributing to product and brand style standardsBeing able to work with and evolve the internal design systemExperienced working in a product team, with a high focus on product, value, and learningRequirementsWork experience as a Product Designer of a product teamExperience in conducting User Research activities together with product managers and other designersAble to blend discovery and delivery practices effectivelyComfortable in facilitating customer-facing activities and workshopsPortfolio of design projects showing skills relevant to this positionKnowledge and experience with wireframe and prototyping tools (e.g. Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, UXPin...)A critical eye for discussing and evaluating the design and giving feedbackGood time-management and planning skills with a team-player attitudeStrong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders and cultivate a design culture in the organizationA recommended practices promoter and advocate, not accepting an “It works for me” attitudeWho we areA highly diverse team spanning a wide range of both professional and cultural backgrounds - from compliance lawyers and researchers to technology experts, designers and developers. This is a unique set up within our industry and the perfect foundation for revolutionizing the compliance space by raising the bar through innovative technology.GAN Integrity is a global company with offices in NYC, Copenhagen, and London and has over 150 Fortune 1000 customers, most of which are large public corporations. GAN Integrity has raised venture capital from leading firms such as Edison Ventures and Aquiline Capital Partners. Learn more at www.ganintegrity.com.Our ValuesOur core mission is “we empower organizations to do the right thing”. As our business grows, “doing the right thing” is the foundation of all that we do – this guides the culture we are building internally and sets the expectations of how we partner with our customers. We set high standards for ourselves and each other.To be successful at GAN Integrity, we are looking for individuals who can adapt to a rapidly growing business in an emerging space; who share our belief in doing the right thing; who recognize that we are better together than better as one(self); and who brings energy and enthusiasm in all that they do.It’s hard work, it’s sometimes not easy, but we are reimagining the future of the industry which brings huge opportunities.To be successful at GAN you must have;The ability to adapt to a rapidly growing business in an emerging spaceSuperior communication and listening skillsHigh ethical standards and demonstrate transparency about everything you doA natural curiosity and the ability to see and help to resolve issuesA level of self-awareness that enables you to collaborate with both your GAN colleagues and customersThe ability to take ownership of tasks and be a self-starter - you must be prepared to adapt to an ever-changing landscape with multiple prioritiesWhat we offerCompetitive salary, plus share/stock options.Excellent growth opportunities.Work with an amazing team of talented and motivated people who love their work.Flexible working hours.Contribute to a truly important cause - work with purpose.A real impact on the company’s growth and evolution.Great office space and central location in the heart of Copenhagen near Kgs. Have.Social activities: quizzes, movie nights, DHL run, Friday bars, office parties, and much, much more (well - some of this currently somewhat modified to be COVID-19 safe!)Amazing lunch, free soft drinks, fruit, snacks, and great coffee.GAN Integrity is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that every employee has the right to work in a positive, collaborative atmosphere that promotes equal opportunities and prohibits discriminatory practices.We are conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible.

text:
Head of Product Marketing
💎 What is unique about RokokoRokoko's offering unlocks the talent of millions of emerging creators that need fast, easy, and affordable animation tools.Our tools are designed for independent creators whilst being adopted by some of the world’s largest animation studios, like Netflix, Sony, or Disney.From the heart of Copenhagen, where it began, to our colleagues back in Athens and all the way across the USA, we all echo Rokoko’s calling - to empower the storytellers of tomorrow.None of this would be possible without the humans behind Rokoko.Creative, driven, and passionate about what we do, every day we stand by our mission and we’re looking for talented teammates that can join us to build creative tools within art, entertainment, film, research, education, or health.We collaborate with top-tier game, film, AR/VR, and VFX producers as well as thousands of creators that make unique content.Dare to join us too, we’d love to have you. 🔥What’s the role aboutThe mission of this role is to accelerate the growth of an industry-leading desktop SaaS built for animators, by championing the customer's perspective, communicating product value, and driving adoption among the right segments of users by leading GTM campaigns.The ideal candidate will have a track record within early-stage SaaS product marketing, where product launches, feature positioning, and end-to-end marketing activities are native to you. 🙌 Where you come inAs we develop new software products and features to better serve and access new customers, you will play a leading role in determining the GTM strategy and how we scale sales.You'll utilize product marketing frameworks to own positioning, lead cross-functional product and feature launch processes, covering acquisition through to advocacy.You'll be the main liaison between product, marketing, and C-level on everything to do with product and feature launches.You'll partner with cross-functional management to nurture and establish product partnerships.You'll nurture industry understanding and continuously evaluate how ecosystem players interact with each other and the role we play. Likewise, you'll be responsible for the enablement of other commercial teams, acting as an internal product, customer, and industry expert.You'll partner with our in-house content team to develop compelling and useful content to educate existing and prospective customers.You'll be responsible for hiring and building our product marketing function covering both hardware and software.🕵️ What you need to succeed in this roleYou have at least 5 years of experience in an early-stage SaaS, with a proven track record of product marketing or management.You're a natural leader who takes pride in your work and feels a sense of ownership and accountability in the outcomes you drive.You don’t get tired of constantly improving and trying out new things, in fact, you find meaning and joy in that.You possess solid problem-solving skills, you are analytical and with ease are using data to prove a hypothesis.Demonstrated ability to operate in cross-functional environments where you're comfortable navigating multiple responsibilities, technical conversations, and customer types.Demonstrated experience drawing logical conclusions from data to inform decision-making.Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to deliver actionable and straightforward analysis.Experience working or taking interest in the creative industry and a familiarity with creative tools are preferred.Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills.❤️ Rokoko perks and benefitsWork with an international team of 70+ talented individuals and a rare opportunity to work with professional motion capture/or other ESP.Fantastic office location, catered lunch scheme, healthy snacks and beverages, and #coffee breaks.25 days of paid holiday(annual) and 5 optional(unpaid)Optional healthcare insurance and pension schemeWork-life balance - we want you to win both at work and in lifeQuarterly education fund programCompany fun runs - we love sporty outdoors activities from casual runs to marathonsRegular social gatherings, both in person and digitally.A quite unique opportunity to join Rokoko at the most exciting scale-up phase. We offer a steep learning curve and an ambitious work environment.✨ Check us out2021 has been an unprecedented year for us at Rokoko.We've grown across teams and have welcomed 50+ talented people among our teams.We've launched a new generation of the industry's favorite mocap suit, the Smartsuit Pro II.We've seen first-hand our mission to make motion capture widely accessible demonstrated in the many works of our talented community, using our tools as a vessel to push boundaries of digital artistry.Have a peek at this 3 min user reel that sums up some of the cool things we do here.Thirsty for more?Browse our Instagram stories and posts on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and TikTok. and join our community of 3D artists, VFX experts, and game devs on Discord.Pst...and check some of our user stories here 😲 How to really catch our eyeWe take the recruitment process seriously. That’s because we care a lot about who are we about to work with. We hope that matters equally to you.This is what the process will look like:Initial callInterview with the Hiring ManagerAssignmentFollow-up talk on the assignmentCultural meeting with some of your future colleaguesWe respect everyone's time and do our best to optimize and streamline our recruitment process depending on circumstances or roles. However, we put all our heart and time to find the next gem that will join the team ✨Hoping this caught your interest enough, we look forward to receiving your application in English, together with your strong motivation in any shape or form - be creative, we value that. A lot. 👋 When and how to expect to hear from usWe know how seeking your next gig works - sometimes you'll apply and never hear back. We’ve all been there.While we can't send tailored feedback to every candidate, please be aware that we're so grateful for you taking the time and the courage to put yourself out there. It means the world to us that you believe we're worth checking your profile. We screen all applications thoroughly and reach out to the ones we find most suitable while all candidates get feedback once we have reached a decision.We do value transparency a lot here, so here’s a confession - we are aware the recruitment and selection process can be inherently subjective to various circumstances or specific role requirements. We do our absolute best to reach a decision piece by piece and as fast as we can and we sincerely appreciate your patience in this process.And if the time was not right for us now, for whatever reason, let’s try one more time. We hope our paths will cross again.Keep an eye on us, as we're growing pretty quickly and quite remarkably.Rokoko is an equal opportunity employer, therefore we do not select candidates based on sex or gender identity, mental disability or physical disability, religion, age, national origin or ethnicity, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or parental status.At Rokoko, we breathe diversity and creativity. Whatever your path or background is, however you express or identify yourself, join us and let’s get things in motion.

text:
Go-To-Market Manager
Do you want to play an important role in transforming how cars are traded in the future? We are looking for a Go-To-Market Manager to be part of building the technology solution and gateway for European Car Trading of the future. The role can be based in Copenhagen or Vejle.AUTOproff is a car trading SaaS solution for the professional market. We are growing fast and serve more than 6,500 customers across the whole professional value chain in several European countries. Our mission is to make it seamless, secure, and more attractive to trade used cars, and we are looking for the right profile to join our journey.As our new Go-To-Market Manager at AUTOproff you will join our dedicated Commercial team in this newly created role. Majority of our commercial team is based at our office in Copenhagen, and this role can be based either at our office in Copenhagen or at our HQ in Vejle.Your mission will be to plan, drive and execute the Go-to-Market activities to ensure commercial impact and be instrumental to create structure, drive and lead the product/service updates and new launches across multiple European markets. You will report to our Sales Excellence Director.You will be the central point for stakeholders when launching new products and services across Europe, and you will have the full overview and coordinate and plan activities across functions and stakeholders.To be successful in this role, you will establish a good relation, and a strong synergy between product, sales, customer service, marketing, finance, legal and the leadership team to ensure that the entire organisation works towards the same goals, by defining and executing on actions, led by the Go-To-Market Manger.The key is therefore to be operationally efficient and work cross-functionally with all levels of the organisation, communicate and onboard new products etc.Let's dive into your key responsibilitiesIdentify key GTM activities in conjunction with all parts of the company, to manage a product launch or change which affects the customers.Analyse data and find insights to guide strategic decisions and enhance Sales' ability to go-to-market, such as new market launches, customer segmentation definition, and lead generation programsIndependently identify growth opportunities, lead discussions to advocate for resourcing the project, lead the project, and implement tracking infrastructure and visualization to report on resultsManage relationships with Partnerships, Product, Marketing, Finance, Data Science, and more to promote Sales growth and profitabilityProactively identify and anticipate GTM roadblocks of technical, business, political, or organizational nature and actively seek resolution with leadership and peersThe need-to-have skillsWe are looking for a new colleague with strong organizing capabilities and motivation to structure and plan key activities and independently drive the work often in a very unstructured but fast-moving environment. Furthermore, we expect that you have:Bachelor’s degree in business or marketing, or equivalentExperience developing, implementing and executing Go-to-Market strategiesExcellent communication skills, and fluency Danish as well as English (both verbal and written). German language skills would be an extra advantage.Strong project management skills, and experience with project- and implementation planningExcellent stakeholder management skills, and good experience communicating with a broad range of stakeholders of both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple teamsThe nice-to-have skillsExperience in B2B/Enterprise software Go-to-Market strategies with an emphasis on SaaSKnowledge of CRM systemsYou will thrive in this role if youEnjoy an entrepreneurial, ambitious, and fast changing work-environment where self-motivated individuals succeedSolutions-oriented and willing to go that extra mile to succeedYour colleagues say about youStrong interpersonal skills and great ability to establish strong relations and partnershipsProactive with an innovative and can-do attitudeGood team-player with strong collaboration skillsPositive mind-set and attitude, and fun to be aroundIf you think we could be a match, we can’t wait to hear from you. Hurry up and apply!If this role doesn’t fit your profile – don’t hesitate to reach out if you want to join a fun and fast-growing SaaS company on a mission! We are constantly on the lookout for new and awesome colleagues.About AUTOproffAUTOproff was founded in 2013, became the market leader in Denmark in 2016, and has since expanded across Northern Europe covering Germany, Denmark, Netherlands, Sweden, Norway, and Poland. We employ 100+ enthusiastic professionals across our offices.In 2020, we posted revenues of more than DKK 400 million and we have been profitable since our inception. AUTOproff is privately owned by Jesper Ratza, our CEO and founder, André Rogaczewski, CEO and co-founder of Netcompany, key employees, and as well as other private investors.
