UX Writer
Join a fast growing music tech scale-up, where you'll have impact from your first week.Linkfire is the global leader in smart links for the music streaming industry with 70% market share. Our partners include Warner Music Group, Apple Music, Sony Music, Universal Music Group and many others so if you're passionate about music, you'll fit right in! The music streaming industry is growing quickly with revenues estimated to triple and grow to $75B by 2030. Linkfire recently went public on Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market in Stockholm.As a UX Writer you will facilitate building the biggest global discovery network in the music industry and connecting creators/artists with fans through a world class user experience and a distinctive brand. We are looking for a UX Writer who is a champion at design thinking, comfortable working in Figma, a Notion advocate, thinks big but can manage all types of product writing challenges, is detail-oriented, organised, curious, and collaborative.We are looking for someone who is highly skilled, self-driven, and used to working as part of a product team. You will work closely across all product teams from discovery sprints to product launches. UX Writers at Linkfire are given a lot of autonomy and trust, to shape and create solutions in close collaboration with the product designers and product teams. In this role you'll report to the Lead Product Designer.We strive to be clear and understandable. Sure, there are spaces to inject a bit of our brand voice – but not at the expense of clarity. Most of our product strives for ultimate simplicity, but simplicity is complicated. Often we have to translate a complex flow into an easy interface – and in that interface, copy plays an integral role in its success. This is why our UX Writer position is in the design team, working hands-on with designers to figure out the solution.What you'll be doingThe first full-time writer in our product team – with lots of room for career growth as the discipline grows within our companyCreate clear, consistent, and impactful copy across all of our product interfacesWork closely with our brand content writers to reflect Linkfire's brand in our product where appropriateImprove the writing capabilities of our Product Design team with processes, practices and educationTake part in design reviews and give feedback and coaching when neededMake data-informed decisions through research and user testingCollaborate with product managers, strategists, engineers, and researchersEducate the broader organisation, from sales to support, around proper product terminologyWork with other writers from our Marketing and Comms teams to define and implement tone and voice standardsFreedom to define your own approach for bringing great copy into our product and culture. There is a great opportunity here to define how you want to work and how you want to ensure only the best of the best copy gets read by our customers; copy that is part of the solution and not just some icing on top.Who you areA native English speaker, or someone with near-native fluencyYou're an excellent communicator with the ability to effectively tell the narrative behind your product copy decisions and to engage your stakeholders.You're user-focused and data-informed. Your product instincts and writing skills are excellent, but you still always strive to validate your work with user feedback and testing.You have a passion for complex problem-solving and can turn insights into copy solutions. You have the ability to take complex concepts and make them easy to understand using simple, human words. You have the ability to find potential problems that our customers might have with our copy/designs.You take initiative and you take responsibility, meaning you are a self-starter that makes things happen, and you are result and solutions-oriented.You collaborate well with others within your own team and across teams and you support others to reach team goals.Being a part of the Linkfire team comes withA competitive compensation package, pension contribution and health care benefits, in addition to a laptop and phone / compensating your phone billMonthly mental or physical wellness budgetAbility to work remotely or onsite in our Copenhagen headquarters. We offer relocation to Copenhagen as well.Catered lunch in our Copenhagen office25 days of annual holidays, on top of the standardised festive and bank-related ones, of courseContinual learning and development opportunitiesInternational work environment with many different nationalities and offices in Copenhagen, New York, LA and LisbonGreat support and encouragement from us if you want to host MeetUps, events, etc - we'll help (venue, food etc)Social and team gatheringsMusic has the unique power to unite us all. It transcends cultures, languages, and borders.Every day, we help artists from around the world connect with their fans, and we’re immensely proud to count such a diverse range of creators as our users.We embrace this diversity inside our offices too. At Linkfire, we want you to find a place to belong, and feel encouraged to be your authentic self.We therefore do not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected classification or status.Sounds like you? If so, submit your CV in English and your portfolio. We’ll be in touch!

Do you want to be a part of the world’s leading jewellery company while putting your experience in technology into use? If yes, then we have an exciting opportunity for you! You will be part of an growing digital & tech team and work in an international organisation of can-do spirited, passionate, and performance-driven people. We value flexibility and informal working, where you are trusted to deliver and to focus on outcomes and value.
 
About the Team: Building an E2E integrated and agile supply chain is a key pillar on our Digital strategy to deliver on our company ambitions and our promise to consumers and customers. We are embracing a scaled Agile setup structured around product teams with clear focus on business outcomes. You will play the leading role in driving initiatives within merchandising and supply chain planning solutions. You will act as the connector between functional needs and technology and ensure we are always working on the things that create value for our consumers and our business.
 
As Product Management Director in Integrated Planning you will be accountable to drive the product lifecycle, define the product roadmap and defining user stories and prioritization of the product backlog.
You will collaborate closely with a wide range of stakeholders across Merchandising, Supply Chain, Manufacturing planning to understand and sharpen the needs of the various planning organizations across the value chain of Pandora, as well as work with your cross-functional product teams and the entire tech organization to bring those needs to life.
 
Through strong people skills, leadership and know-how within planning technology you will co-own creation and delivery of the Integrated Planning strategy with other business functions, to realize our ambitions of improved product availability for our end-consumers. You will deliver an ambitions roadmap of building world-class solutions with areas such as forecasting, supply/capacity planning, S&OP, merchandise financial planning, replenishment and assortment planning. As part of the role, you will focus on creating a strong culture around product management and end-user centricity, while collaborating with peers on agile ways of working and an engaging engineering culture across the scaled agile setup.
 
In your role, you will be accountable for:
· Co-author and execute the long-term product strategy and roadmap of your team by identifying meaningful customer and business problems to solve
· Identify and deliver impactful solutions to those problems by building up a deep understanding of critical business and customer needs
· Build strong working relationships across multiple business and tech teams to collaborate and remove unnecessary complexity starting with the customer and working backwards to derive scalable solutions.
· Lead a team of product managers and business analysts/functional consultants working in Agile product teams.
· Lead the product management practices across the overall Product Line, incl. applying repeatable best practice product methodologies in cross-functional teams incorporating problem discovery, defining & designing solutions, and delivering agreed outcomes
· Ensuring the successful adoption and longevity of the technologies enabling the planning organization – from initiation to end-of-life.
 
What is needed to succeed
· Expert knowledge with multiple types of merchandising and supply chain planning solutions
· Proven track record and expertise in working with engineering, product design, and cross-functional partners to build products. Deep experience with product management is a plus.
· Strong experience with people management and leadership, both direct line leadership as well as informal leadership across a large matrix organization.
· Experience from large global companies, preferably within the retail industries.
· Natural problem-solver, with a strong history of driving product discovery, solving meaningful customer and business problems, and delivering scalable solutions
· You enjoy working with many stakeholders and showcase the ability to translate your product plans for any audience, through well-crafted strategic documents, thorough requirements, and clear communication with stakeholders
· Effective influencer and ability to work with large cross-functional teams to manage, support and solve problems
· Being comfortable working with short lead-time, change management and highly volatile environment
· Passion for continuous learning, evangelizing product management and be a promoter of best practices within the team and company
 
 
Icing on the cake
 
You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.
 
About Pandora
 
Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished and contemporary jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 7,500 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.
Founded in 1982 and headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs more than 26,000 people worldwide of whom more than 11,500 are located in Thailand, where the Company manufactures its jewellery. PANDORA is publicly listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange in Denmark. In 2018, Pandora’s total revenue was DKK 22.8 billion (approximately EUR 3.1 billion).

text:
Head of Product Marketing
Rokoko's offering unlocks the talent of millions of emerging creators that need fast, easy, and affordable animation tools. Our tools are designed for independent creators whilst being adopted by some of the world’s largest animation studios, like Netflix, Sony, or Disney.From the heart of Copenhagen, where it began, to our colleagues back in Athens and all the way across the USA, we all echo Rokoko’s calling - to empower the storytellers of tomorrow.None of this would be possible without the humans behind Rokoko.Creative, driven, and passionate about what we do, every day we stand by our mission and we’re looking for talented teammates that can join us to build creative tools within art, entertainment, film, research, education, or health.We collaborate with top-tier game, film, AR/VR, and VFX producers as well as thousands of creators that make unique content.Dare to join us too, we’d love to have you. 🔥 What’s the role aboutThe mission of this role is to accelerate the growth of an industry-leading desktop SaaS built for animators, by championing the customer's perspective, communicating product value, and driving adoption among the right segments of users by leading GTM campaigns.The ideal candidate will have a track record within early-stage SaaS product marketing, where product launches, feature positioning, and end-to-end marketing activities are native to you. 🙌  Where you come in
As we develop new software products and features to better serve and access new customers, you will play a leading role in determining the GTM strategy and how we scale sales.
You'll utilize product marketing frameworks to own positioning, lead cross-functional product and feature launch processes, covering acquisition through to advocacy.
You'll be the main liaison between product, marketing, and C-level on everything to do with product and feature launches.
You'll partner with cross-functional management to nurture and establish product partnerships.
You'll nurture industry understanding and continuously evaluate how ecosystem players interact with each other and the role we play. Likewise, you'll be responsible for the enablement of other commercial teams, acting as an internal product, customer, and industry expert.
You'll partner with our in-house content team to develop compelling and useful content to educate existing and prospective customers.
You'll be responsible for hiring and building our product marketing function covering both hardware and software.
🕵️ What you need to succeed in this role
You have at least 5 years of experience in an early-stage SaaS, with a proven track record of product marketing or management.
You're a natural leader who takes pride in your work and feels a sense of ownership and accountability in the outcomes you drive.
You don’t get tired of constantly improving and trying out new things, in fact, you find meaning and joy in that.
You possess solid problem-solving skills, you are analytical and with ease are using data to prove a hypothesis.
Demonstrated ability to operate in cross-functional environments where you're comfortable navigating multiple responsibilities, technical conversations, and customer types.
Demonstrated experience drawing logical conclusions from data to inform decision-making.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to deliver actionable and straightforward analysis.
Experience working or taking interest in the creative industry and a familiarity with creative tools are preferred.
Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills.
❤️ Rokoko perks and benefits
Work with an international team of 70+ talented individuals and a rare opportunity to work with professional motion capture/or other ESP.
Fantastic office location, catered lunch scheme, healthy snacks and beverages, and #coffee breaks.
25 days of paid holiday(annual) and 5 optional(unpaid)
Optional healthcare insurance and pension scheme
Work-life balance - we want you to win both at work and in life
Quarterly education fund program
Company fun runs - we love sporty outdoors activities from casual runs to marathons
Regular social gatherings, both in person and digitally. 
A quite unique opportunity to join Rokoko at the most exciting scale-up phase. We offer a steep learning curve and an ambitious work environment.
✨  What we brag about2021 has been an unprecedented year for us at Rokoko.We've grown across teams and have welcomed 50+ talented people among our teams.We've launched a new generation of the industry's favorite mocap suit, the Smartsuit Pro II.We've seen first-hand our mission to make motion capture widely accessible demonstrated in the many works of our talented community, using our tools as a vessel to push boundaries of digital artistry.Let's make 2022 even greater, together. Thirsty for more?Browse our Instagram stories and posts on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and TikTok. and join our community of 3D artists, VFX experts, and game devs on Discord.Psst...and check some of our user stories here  Rokoko is an equal opportunity employer, therefore we do not select candidates based on sex or gender identity, mental disability or physical disability, religion, age, national origin or ethnicity, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or parental status.At Rokoko, we breathe diversity and creativity. Whatever your path or background is, however you express or identify yourself, join us and let’s get things in motion.

        Two 2.5 year postdoc positions in Applied Plant Biochemistry and Analytical Chemistry for the Green transition
    

The Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences, Faculty of Science at University of Copenhagen is offering two 2.5-year (30 months) Postdoctoral fellowships commencing 1 July 2022 or as soon as possible thereafter. 
The postdoc’s duties will include research within plant biochemistry and analytical chemistry as well as teaching. The post may also include performance of other duties.
Description of the scientific environment
The two postdoctoral positions are financed by the Novo Nordic Foundation and related to the two projects “EcoSap: triterpenoid saponins as green solutions for future sustainable food production” and “SAP-FATE Biopesticides for sustainable agriculture - Fate, biological activity, and environmental impact of saponins in soils”, and are led by Professor Søren Bak. An assistant professor, a postdoc and a PhD student are already employed, and the project collaborates closely with other research groups at the department and internationally. The successful candidates will be joining an active, diverse and multi-disciplinary research environment seeking to understand how we can learn from nature to defend agricultural plants from especially herbivores. The candidate is expected to collaborate with and co-supervise younger members of the project group. The section has state-of-the-art laboratory facilities, a metabolomics platform, and in-depth experience in plant biochemistry and plant specialized metabolites.
The successful applicants will be based within the Molecular Evolution of Specialized Metabolism research groups in the Plant Biochemistry Section at the Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences. The Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences is a large department (around 450 employees) dedicated to plant, microbial, and environmental sciences. Further information on the Faculty of Science is linked at https://www.science.ku.dk/english/about-the-faculty/organisation/.
Project description
World agricultural food and feed production suffers greatly from losses to insect pests. We need alternative green solutions to protect our crops to secure food and feed production. The focus of the EcoSap and SapFate projects is to learn from nature how to protect a future sustainable food production system. We have identified a class of compounds called saponins that can target insect species that are resistant to most synthetic insecticides. The project goes from basic science of how saponins are biosynthesized, stored, their mode of actions to exploring the possibilities of upscaled production of saponins, to their ecotoxicological evaluations and to understand the fate of saponins if applied as biopesticides to soil environments. You will therefore be working together in a multidisciplinary team with specialist within plant specialized metabolites, plant biochemistry, soil chemistry, ecotoxicology, membrane physiology, and microbiology. EcoSap and SAP-FATE are at the very forefront of the Green Transition agenda, and will contribute to positioning plant specialized metabolites as a logical approach to support productivity and resilience of agricultural production systems. 
Position 1: Key scientific qualification areas
The ideal candidate has a background in biochemistry and molecular biology.
The aim of this positions is to expand our molecular tool box for genes encoding for enzymes in saponins biosynthesis. The molecular tool box will be used for tailor production of saponins in planta as well as in vitro for studying structure-activity-relationships.

Enzyme biochemistry and pathway elucidation
Plant molecular biology
Metabolomics and analytical chemistry.
Bioinformatics including molecular phylogeny
Experience on heterologous expression in yeast and E. coli
Plant-insect interactions
Knowledge of natural product metabolism
Strong publication record

Position 2: Key scientific qualification areas 
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in analytical chemistry and biochemistry
The aim of this positions is to find new and sustainable sources of saponins, to establish their scale up for their use as bio-pesticides, and to understand the fate of saponins if applied as bio pesticides to soil environments by generating radiolabeled saponins.  

Analytical chemistry (LCMS, GCMS and NMR)
Enzyme biochemistry
Radiolabeling of compounds
Up to gram scale purification of saponins
Metabolomics
Quality assessment of saponins upscaling
Knowledge of natural products
Strong publication record

Key personal skills for both positions: 

Enthusiasm and good interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to collaborate with others including supervision and mentoring of students
Proved ability to write scientific papers and interested in grant writing.
Language skills, English.
Broad curiosity in biological questions and open-mindedness to cross-disciplinary research
Curiosity driven interdisciplinary approach to science and a generous and open mindset
Ability to work independently and manage your research project
Ability to critically review research results generated as part of the project
Engagement in Departmental and Laboratory activities including lab duties, teaching and dissemination of your research
Ensuring GLP and general safety operations

Formal requirements
Applicants should hold a PhD degree in biochemistry, biotechnology, molecular biology, plant biology or analytical chemistry, and should be fluent in both spoken and written English. Previous publications and relevant postdoc experiences, including teaching, will be included in the assessment of your qualifications.
Terms of employment 
The position is covered by the Memorandum on Job Structure for Academic Staff.
Terms of appointment and payment accord to the agreement between the Ministry of Finance and The Danish Confederation of Professional Associations on Academics in the State.
Negotiation for salary supplement is possible.
Application Procedure
The application, in English, must be submitted electronically by clicking APPLY NOW below.
Please include 

Cover Letter (detailing your motivation and background for applying for a specific project)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master and PhD degree or equivalent)
Research plan – description of current and future research plans
Complete publication list
Separate reprints of up to 3 particularly relevant papers
Teaching experience and other relevant experiences

The University wishes our staff to reflect the diversity of society and thus welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.
The deadline for applications is April 18th, 2022 21:59 GMT +2. Applications received after the deadline for applications will not be considered.
After the expiry of the application deadline, the authorized recruitment manager selects applicants for assessment on the advice of the Interview Committee. Afterwards an assessment committee will be appointed to evaluate the selected applications. The applicants will be notified of the composition of the committee and the final selection of a successful candidate will be made by the Head of Department, based on the recommendations of the assessment committee and the interview committee.
The main criterion for selection will be the research potential of the applicant and the above-mentioned skills.
Questions
For specific information about the position, please contact Professor Søren Bak, e-mail: bak@plen.ku.dk, Section for Plant Biochemistry, Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences.

        Platform Manager for the Metabolomics Platform
    

The Novo Nordisk Foundation Center for Basic Metabolic Research
Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences
University of Copenhagen
We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Platform Manager to develop and manage the Metabolomics Platform to commence June 1, 2022, or after agreement, at the Novo Nordisk Foundation Center for Basic Metabolic Research (CBMR), University of Copenhagen.
The successful candidate will work in the Metabolic Platform that provides the Center’s researchers with targeted and untargeted metabolomics analyses, as well as lipidomics analysis.
Your job
As a Platform Manager in the Metabolomics Platform, you will be coordinating a team of specialists and technicians as well as be responsible for the day-to-day project coordination. You will play an important role in developing the platform while working in close collaboration with Platform Leader Professor Thomas Moritz and key platform scientists.
The job spans over facility management, organization, people, and projects. The balance of the tasks will depend on the profile of the candidate.
Key responsibilities

Platform management
Coordination, prioritization and planning of projects and tasks
Implementation of facility management procedures and software solutions including equipment/service booking systems, usage tracking, data management solutions, SOP handling, user satisfaction surveys, emergency plans for equipment breakdown
Ensure good communication and collaboration between platform staff, platform users, service collaborators, and leadership
Optimization of the physical frames and usage of the current facility
Preparation and implementation of short and long-term expansion and development plans for the facility
Ensure implementation of new experimental procedures and technologies

About CBMR
Our researchers share a common purpose as they seek to transform the basic understanding of the mechanisms that underlie metabolic health and disease, and to accelerate this knowledge toward new prevention and treatment strategies. The Center was established in 2010 and in 2017, we moved into new laboratories, offices, and meeting rooms in the Maersk Tower www.maersktower.ku.dk.
The Center has around 260 employees, consisting of 21 research groups and 5 technology platforms, who work in a vibrant international research environment with a focus on interdisciplinary collaboration. The Center’s research has resulted in seminal discoveries as to how genes, hormones, and environmental factors influence metabolic health and disease throughout life. You may read more about us at www.cbmr.ku.dk. 
The Platform
The Metabolomics Platform is an integral part of the Center and was established in 2019. The Platform offers experimental and computational services, and assistance with project planning of metabolomics-based projects on a case-by-case basis, as they will be depending on the biological system and question. We find that in-house expertise and services help our scientists streamline their research, so they can achieve their research goals faster. The Platform team comprises laboratory technicians and specialists and is headed by Professor Thomas Moritz. 
Learn more about the platform here.
Your Profile
Essential criteria

The successful candidate has experience with project and team management, a PhD degree or equivalent in a biological or chemical sciences-related discipline
Solid experience in data management, calculations, statistics, and data presentation
Strong problem-solving skills, interpersonal skills, and the ability to work independently
Proven experience in training and supervision
A service-minded and team player attitude
A structured mind-set and a pronounced organizational talent
Good communication skills in both written and spoken English

Other aspects that would be considered a plus:

Experience/interest in analytical chemistry
Experience/interest in mass spectrometry-based analyses
Experience/interest in metabolomics

We offer
Creative and stimulating working conditions in dynamic and international research environment.

Highly motivated and collaborative colleagues 
Attractive employment conditions
A centrally located workplace.

Place of employment
The place of employment is the Novo Nordisk Foundation Center for Basic Metabolic Research, Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences, University of Copenhagen.
Terms of salary and employment
The employment as Platform Manager, positioned as Research Consultant, is a full time and 3-year position. Employment will be in accordance with the provisions of the collective agreement between the Danish Government and AC (the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) with a possibility to negotiate supplements due to qualifications and experience.
Questions
For further questions about the job description and qualifications, please contact Professor Thomas Moritz at thomas.moritz@sund.ku.dk. For questions regarding the recruitment procedure, please contact SUND HR CBMR at SUND-HR-CBMR@sund.ku.dk
Application
The application must be submitted in English and include the following:

Letter of motivation
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas – all relevant certificates
List of publications

How to apply
The application, in English, must be submitted electronically by clicking APPLY NOW below or via this advertisement found on http://employment.ku.dk. Only online applications will be accepted.
We reserve the right not to consider material received after the deadline, and not to consider applications that do not live up to the abovementioned requirements.
Application deadline: April 20, 2022, at 23:59 CET.

Ansøg online




DTU Health Tech is looking for a PhD candidate in data science for cardiovascular diseases (CVD). The purpose of this project is to research, design, implement, and test a workflow pipeline for training of machine learning prediction algorithms for cardiovascular events.

You will join the Digital Health section of DTU Health Tech. We are a multi-disciplinary team of biomedical engineers, computer scientists, and UX researchers who research digital technologies for health, healthcare, and life science, in order to improve healthcare delivery and make healthcare more personalized and precise. We have an extensive research record within data science in CVD and you will join a team of senior researchers and other PhD students working with us. You will also work closely with cardiologists at the Department of Cardiology at the Copenhagen University Hospital (Danish: Bispebjerg-Frederiksberg Hospital) who will provide clinical supervision.

Responsibilities and qualifications
Your research will focus on establishing an end-to-end pipeline for data science in CVD with a special focus on atrial fibrillation (AF) and heart failure (HF). This pipeline will consist of three main parts: (i) collection of ECG and contextual data from patients, (ii) ground-truth annotation from clinicians, and (iii) a self-optimizing and extensible data science analysis engine containing model for prediction of cardiac events. Primary focus is on the overall software architecture and distributed system design of the pipeline, secondary on the user experience (UX) design of the data collection sub-systems, and tertiary on the design of data science methods.

This position requires skills in software engineering, mobile sensing, UX design, and health data science, including software development, mobile programming, sensor integration, distributed computing, and data processing using modern AI- and ML-based tools. Furthermore, a structured approach to research and strong communication skills in English in written and oral dissemination is core. Finally, since you will be spending time with a clinical team at the hospital, good collaborative skills and understanding of clinical work is also important.

From an academic point of view, you must have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree in addition to a bachelor’s degree (180 ECTS points).

Ideally, your master degree should be in computer science / engineering or biomedical engineering with a focus on software engineering and data science.

More specifically you should have most of the following qualifications:

Strong theoretical and practical background in software engineering, software architecture, distributed computing, data science, and human-computer interaction.
Experience in mobile sensing, ubiquitous computing, and wearable devices.
Experience in data science methods, incl. machine/deep learning algorithms, especially in ECG or other biomedical signal processing applications.
Strong mastery of a programming languages like Python, Java, Kotlin, Dart, Swift, or similar.
Strong communication skills in English – both in writing and orally.
Knowledge on clinical work, e.g., in cardiology

The language of communication at DTU is English.

Approval and Enrolment
The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education.  

We offer
DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.

Salary and appointment terms
The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years. Start date is as soon as possible.

You can read more about career paths at DTU here.

Further information
If you want to know more, please contact the main supervisor directly – Jakob E. Bardram at: jakba [at] dtu.dk.

Read more about:

DTU Health Tech
The Digital Health section
The PhD School at DTU Health Tech
mCardia – and example of our work in CVD

If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark.

Application procedure
Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 31 May 2022 (Danish time). Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply online", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file. The file must include:

A letter motivating the application (cover letter)
Curriculum vitae 
Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma including official description of grading scale
Links to, or copy of any research papers you may have been part of
Link to a code portfolio stored in an online repositories like GitHub 

You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it. 

Incomplete applications will not be considered. Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.

DTU Health Tech engages in research, education, and innovation base on technical and natural science for the healthcare sector. The Healthcare sector is a globally expanding market with demands for the most advanced technological solutions. DTU Health Tech creates the foundation for companies to develop new and innovative services and products which benefit people and create value for society. DTU Health Techs expertise spans from imaging and biosensor techniques, across digital health and biological modelling, to biopharma technologies. The department has a scientific staff of about 210 persons, 140 PhD students and a technical/administrative support staff of about 160 persons, of which a large majority contributes to our research infrastructure and related commercial activities.

Technology for people

Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear vision to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That vision lives on today. DTU has 12,900 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.

Postdoc in Advanced 3D Microscopy and Image Analysis for Intestinal Drug Delivery



DTU Health Tech

























                Monday 28 Mar 22
            





Apply for this job

Apply no later than 11 April 2022
Apply for the job at DTU Health Tech by completing the following form.

Apply online




DTU Health Tech is looking for an experienced and highly motivated biomedical scientist with an extensive experience in optical tissue clearing, 3D microscopy and advanced image analysis to join Center for Intestinal Absorption and Transport of Biopharmaceuticals (CitBIO).

As our new colleague, you will be part of a highly motivated cross-disciplinary team focused on deciphering mechanism of intestinal transport and developing new strategies for oral drug delivery. The university is located in the greater Copenhagen area, which is acknowledged for its high standards of living and welfare system.

The job
Our aim is to better understand the mechanisms of transport through the intestinal wall and apply the obtained knowledge to improve the delivery of therapeutics. Led by PI Thomas L. Andresen, our team works in multiple directions from developing and synthesis of formulations to in vivo studies and advanced 3D imaging.

You will be responsible for designing and performing various in vivo studies predominantly involving application of ex vivo 3D microscopy of optically cleared tissue and advanced high-throughput image analysis of large datasets.

You will be a part of collaborative projects, carrying an important role of providing crucial insights into connections between features of intestinal transport with features of intestinal issue microenvironment including blood and lymph vessels. This position implies interactions with specialists from various fields of science and thereby requires excellent communication skills.

Responsibilities 

Designing and performing in vivo studies on rodents
Biological tissue processing including application and optimization of various tissue clearing approaches depending on the research tsk
Fluorescent labelling of relevant epitopes
Performing 3D microscopy of large tissue samples (both light sheet and confocal)
Development, optimization and application of advanced high-throughput approaches for image analysis of large 3D imaging datasets
Management, handling and statistical analysis of large data 
Interpretation of data on intestinal transport and its features under both physiological and pathological conditions.
Documentation, communication and dissemination of obtained results.  

Our expectations of you
You must hold a PhD degree (or equivalent) ideally in medicine or biomedicine and certificate allowing to perform animal experiments (EU functions ABD).

Qualifications:                      

Knowledge of human and rodent physiology and pathophysiology. 
Experience with animal studies
Experience with 3D fluorescent microscopy (light sheet, confocal)
Experience with advanced high throughput 3D image analysis and related scripting (e.g. ImageJ macro, Python)
Experience with large data management and high statistical analysis using programing (e.g. Python or R)
Knowledge in intestinal regulation and pathologies is an advantage

We offer
DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.

Salary and terms of employment
The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union.

The period of employment is 2 years. Expected starting date is 1 June 2022 – or according to mutual agreement.

You can read more about career paths at DTU here.  

Further information
Further information may be obtained from Associate Professor Jonas R. Henriksen, +45 4058 2866.

You can read more about DTU Health Tech at www.healthtech.dtu.dk/english.

If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark. 

Application procedure
Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 11 April 2022 (Danish time). Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply online", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file. The file must include:

Application (cover letter)
CV
Academic Diplomas (MSc/PhD)
List of publications 

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.

DTU Health Tech engages in research, education, and innovation base on technical and natural science for the healthcare sector. The Healthcare sector is a globally expanding market with demands for the most advanced technological solutions. DTU Health Tech creates the foundation for companies to develop new and innovative services and products which benefit people and create value for society. DTU Health Techs expertise spans from imaging and biosensor techniques, across digital health and biological modelling, to biopharma technologies. The department has a scientific staff of about 210 persons, 140 PhD students and a technical/administrative support staff of about 160 persons, of which a large majority contributes to our research infrastructure and related commercial activities.

Technology for people
DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear vision to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That vision lives on today. DTU has 12,900 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.

Apply no later than 9 May 2022

If you are an experienced researcher within the field of Sustainability and Circular Economy, interested in pushing the boundaries of sustainability modelling, then consider joining us at DTU!
We are seeking one or several Postdocs as part of the Technical University of Denmark (DTU’s) current activities in establishing a Centre for Absolute Sustainability. A common methodological platform for technology research is currently being laid for the Centre, to which these Postdoc positions will provide important contributions, with particular focus on sustainability modelling and resource circularity.
Circular economy, material flows and resource circularity are pivotal for the transition towards a sustainable society. However, not all “circular” solutions are necessarily sustainable and circular economy in itself may not lead to absolute sustainability. Making things better is not enough – our solutions should be good enough. To support this transition, we need to develop the sustainability assessment methodologies required to appropriately integrate resource circularity, to establish the assessment modelling tools needed to achieve the right insights at system and technology levels, and to extend resource circularity into the context of absolute sustainability. 
You will join an internationally leading research team with an establish track-record within environmental life cycle assessment (LCA), life cycle costing (LCC), material flow analysis (MFA), resource characterisation, and circularity assessments. We work with a wide range of stakeholders within research, industry, and public authorities, in the field of circular economy, waste management and resource circularity. We address both hands-on case-studies as well as method and model development. Our intentions are always to move understanding one step further.
In addition to the scientific focus, outlined above, you will contribute to establishment of the Centre and assist with a range of the Centre’s activities within research, outreach, and education.
Responsibilities and qualifications
You should be highly motivated and self-driven, as well as have strong work ethics, team spirit and excellent collaboration skills. You take responsibility for your work in an organised and structured manner. 
As a formal qualification, you must hold a PhD degree (or equivalent), preferably within environmental engineering. 
As an ideal candidate, you have documented experience with the following:

Environmental life cycle assessment modelling and/or life cycle cost modelling of circular economy systems and recycling technologies
Material flow analysis at system and regional level
Uncertainty analysis, statistical data management
Programming and establishment of mathematical models
Planetary boundaries and absolute sustainability concepts
Scientific writing and publication at international journal level

Good command of written and spoken English is required. Experience with interdisciplinary is necessary to ensure a strong collaboration with the other colleagues within the Centre.
We offer
DTU is a leading technical university globally recognised for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterised by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility. 
Salary and terms of employment
The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union.
The employment period is 3 years. If the successful candidate prefers 2 years, this can also be agreed. Expected start of employment is as soon as possible in 2022.
You can read more about career paths at DTU here.
Further information
Further information may be obtained from Professor Thomas Fruergaard Astrup, thas@env.dtu.dk. For more info on research, please see profile on DTU Orbit.
You can read more about DTU Environment at www.env.dtu.dk. 
If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark. 
Application procedure 
Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 9 May 2022 (Danish time).
Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply online", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file. The file must include:

Application and motivation (cover letter)
CV
Academic Diplomas (MSc/PhD), an official confirmation letter can be accepted if PhD diploma is not yet issued
List of publications 

Applications are evaluated as they are received. Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.
All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.

A journey where we build a new industry standard, do things differently, drink champagne on Tuesdays, celebrate big wins and learn faster than we have ever imagined. A journey where the company growth is fueled by our growth as professionals and individuals. A journey where you bring yourself to work. Be ready for a meritocracy of ideas, feedback, big challenges and a fast evolving work life. You want meaning, growth and responsibility - we got it!Oh, and what do we do… We re-shape the way the world’s biggest consumer brands and retailers work and collaborate together. With a super cool software platform built for humans, not processes. It’s huge and super exciting!And how do we do it? Atobi is built with the end user in mind, mixing psychological core drivers, gaming and performance to ensure success on all levels!What We’re Looking ForTo be the perfect fit for our Customer Success Team, we need you to be a powerful advocate and partner to our customers. You are empathetic, committed, collaborative, detailed, and technically motivated. You are ready to drive strong business outcomes and lifetime value for our customers. So you need to be able and ready to take ownership of the customer, challenges and solutions! But don’t worry, the rest of the team is there to support you and make you feel like a success!As a Customer Success Manager, you will be working closely with a wide range of exciting companies worldwide and will interact with internal and external stakeholders across different business functions.This position is perfect for an experienced problem-solver, who is enthusiastic about the tech world and likes to be an integral part of an expanding organization.ResponsibilitiesSupport clients in carrying out a successful Atobi launch by sharing best practices, communication materials and monitoring adoption/success of the Atobi launch: you are their Polar Star!Establish trusted/strategic relationships with clients and continuously support them uncover their business needs to ensure they realize the full potential of AtobiIntroduce clients to Customer Success initiatives, direct the overall deployment and implementation process, and own post-implementation activities such as business reviews, value realization meetings, etc.Analyze clients’ usage data to uncover additional use-case and commercial opportunitiesAdvocate for and act as the ‘voice of the customer’ when collaborating with other business functions internally (i.e., Product, Implementation Partners, Support, Marketing, Sales, etc.)Keep records of key customer information, events, and meetings to create transparency between customer-facing stakeholdersRequirementsAt least 1 year of Customer Success Management experience (or similar customer-facing roles), ideally at SaaS companyFluency in Spanish and English is mandatory. French or German is a big plus.Ability to prioritize short and long term tasks based on urgency, importance, and impactSolid relationship-building skills: The ability to understand different external/internal stakeholders and identify their perspectives and needs; ability to build professional relationships with people and handle their expectationsAbility to work collaboratively across the team and different departments and communicate your thoughts clearly and professionally in a presentation settingA self-starter with the ability to thrive in an ever-growing and high-growth environment. And you need to be able to get things done.About AtobiAtobi is the first-ever retail execution and collaboration cloud that seamlessly captures data between retailers and suppliers and turns them into actionable Insights.An innovative platform that fundamentally changes the way retailers and brands do business together. Already validated by the biggest brands and retailers in the world.Located on Pilestræde in Copenhagen, Atobi is one of the fastest growing SaaS companies in Europe.As a key member of the team you will be working with Atobi’s biggest customers in Europe and Central America.The application deadline is April 15th, we expect the starting date to be June 01.We are going through a crucial time, and need you to be onboard this summer: You can work remotely, but during July and August we need you full time - that’s why we are looking for our new crew member right now!We look forward to talking to you!

text:
Swedish speaker for Lenus nutrition content Team
Were looking for a Native Swedish speaker for Lenus Content Team Could you see yourself thriving in a fast-paced global culture, translating various content into Swedish and creating recipes in order to support an impactful vision of making the world a happier and healthier place? Then this could be the dream opportunity you've been looking for.Who are we looking for?  Lenus is seeking a student in linguistics to translate our platform content into Swedish. This is a role that requires perfect Swedish language skills to ensure that our services have the highest standard.  ResponsibilitiesYou will focus on translating and proofreading recipes from English to Swedish by using common culinary phrases and vocabulary in your native languageYou will also be required to translate and proofread various parts of the system and texts from English to Swedish You will help the Nutritional Content Team support coaches and clients on various system related and meal related questions and issuesYou will create nutritious and tasty recipes for the Swedish marketYou will assist the Nutritional Content Team in updating and maintaining the food database for the Swedish market QualificationsWe would like you to be a student in linguistics with native Swedish language skillsWe would like you to have a great interest in health, nutrition, and fitnessWe would like you to be experienced in the kitchen and familiar with culinary phrases used in recipes in your native language We would like you to be able to work for approximately 15-20 hours/weekWe would like you to be a native speaker from Sweden and possibly fluent in another language We would like you to have been living in Sweden for many years and thereby know what ingredients are available in Swedish supermarkets and used in Swedish cuisine We would like you to have good work ethics and an enthusiastic approachWe would like you to be highly organized, enjoy managing multiple projects, and be able to adjust priorities to meet deadlinesWe require excellent English language skills Insider Benefits 🦾 Aside from the opportunity to work with incredibly talented people, joining the Lenus team means being a part of a team where positive vibes are constant and no two days are alike. Though we value the headspace to get things done, we genuinely enjoy spending time with each other. Join us on our trailblazing adventure and experience the following benefits:​​​​​​​A fast-growing, engaging, young-spirited, and informal work environment with over 350 dedicated colleagues representing over 30 nationalitiesThe opportunity to collaborate with industry experts, world-class creative partners, and specialized colleaguesA competitive salaryExperiential social events & a great company cultureDelicious office snacks and drinks, and a nourishing lunch daily!A MacBook ​​​​​​​Our Journey from Scale-Up to Unicorn 🚀 Lenus is the world’s leading health-tech platform in pursuit of global health, happiness included!We provide the world's top recognized & next generation coaches, including fitness experts, nutritionists, athletes, and mindset & habit coaches, to provide a greater number of people with access to the expertise they need to live happier and healthier lives.Using the Lenus all-in-one platform, coaches can efficiently manage their clients, even as their business scales significantly. They can create tailored and effective meal and workout plans, as well as personalized habit and mindset coaching programs, based on the individual needs of their clients.In 2021, Lenus received the largest series A funding round in Denmark's history. The company has grown from 5 to 350 employees with plans to grow towards 750 employees and expand into 7 new countries in 2022. Lenus is growing at a rate of 3X year-on-year, while strategically leading the way in health-tech innovation to fuel happier and healthier lives around the world.Today, Lenus is headquartered in Copenhagen and New York, with offices in London, Stockholm, Berlin, Hamburg, and Los Angeles. Is this opportunity calling you? Then we’d love to hear from you. Please submit your application along with a CV and cover letter describing why you’re the one we are looking for.

text:
Head of Customer Success
Linkfire is the number #1 marketing tool for the creative and entertainment industry. We work with the biggest names in the music industry and route 150+ Million fans every month to the music they love. You will join a company with roots and heart in music. We’re a team of designers, engineers, product managers, and more, drawn from every corner of the globe. The common denominator?Music—we live and breathe the stuff.The RoleWe're looking for a full-time people and data driven Head of Customer Success to make an immediate impact and take ownership of our customer success journey by empowering our customers and colleagues to achieve high customer retention, satisfaction and increase MRR and other revenue streams on existing customers. You will also play a key role in continuously creating and updating our Customer Success Playbook for upselling and cross-selling strategies to existing accounts, including but not limited to: API, additional services, upsell on product tiersAs our Head of Customer Success you have the overall commercial responsibility for our users across the globe and will be reporting to our Chief Commercial  OfficerWhat you will doAnalyze and Report:Document and analyze all current Customer Success processes and drive improvementsWork with Senior Management to drive departmental KPIs including adoption rates, maturity, and growthP&L of existing customers, account management, retention and up-sales activitiesLeveraging data in key decision making, strategy development, and day-to-day executionBuild and report on all Customer Success KPIs to the CCO/CFO with ad hoc requests as well as reporting to other relevant stakeholdersCustomer Retention:Build data-driven customer retention programs that foster a systematic approach to maintaining positive engagement and high value-creation for customersSupport the customer success team in crafting solutions to customer problems using our technology and services   Increase Customer Satisfaction (NPS)Define operational metrics and optimizing processes across all stages of the customer journey/post-sale with the purpose of creating a structure to measure and act on customers at risk and up sales opportunities at scaleProduct Advocacy:Collaborating with the product managers and product team to feed customer feedback and issues back into the product development cycleWork with the product team to develop and prioritize product roadmap including feedback on behalf of the teamBecome the stakeholder for Enterprise and Premium clients value-drivers, usage, and workflows with regards to product prioritizationTeam Lead:Lead the Customer Success team to achieve and/or exceed client expectations and customer value creation. Develop and maintain strong customer and partner relationshipsConduct one-on-one review with all Customer Success Staff, understand training and development needs, and develop plans for the improvement of the team's performanceRecruit, test, and hire for the Customer Success team based on criteria agreed upon with CCOImplement and train the team on our customer success stack of IT (Hubspot, Recurly, Intercom, Zendesk, Tableau)Direct the customer success team with weekly, and monthly meetingsAbilities and Skills:You have experience in setting and managing client and partner expectations You have previous experience in a problem solving and conflict resolution roleYou have 2-3 years experience in a management role with accountability to the achievement of KPIs You’re knowledgeable in identifying the skills needed on your teams to drive customer successExcellent communication skills and the ability to listen and understandStrong attention to detail and solid analytical skillsAbout us:Linkfire was founded as a response to the increasingly complex nature of digital music marketing. Listeners the world over are streaming through different services—so how do you connect to all of them at once, simply and smartly?Our technology links fans directly to the content they love in their favorite app. At the same time, we empower everyone from major labels to independent artists with unparalleled audience insights.Since we started, we’ve become a trusted partner to the music industry’s biggest names, as well as thousands of soon-to-be biggest names. We’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with offices in Lisbon, NYC, and LA. Every day we help artists we adore to realize their potential through the power of music data.Underpinning our culture is collaborative, agile processes, and something we like to call the ‘Nordic spirit.’ It means working together with transparency, respect, and honesty. And that goes for the way we do business too. What’s in it for you:The opportunity to create the must-have product for the music industry and ensure that every month over 150+ million music fans get the best experience;An open, informal entrepreneurial startup working environment;A truly international spirit, with 4 global locations and over 25 different nationalities; Enjoy paid daily lunches with your colleaguesThe chance for your work to impact the music consumption of millions of music enthusiasts all over the globeMusic has the unique power to unite us all. It transcends cultures, languages, and borders.Every day, we help artists from around the world connect with their fans, and we’re immensely proud to count such a diverse range of creators as our users.We embrace this diversity inside our offices too. At Linkfire, we want you to find a place to belong and feel encouraged to be your authentic self. We therefore do not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected classification or status.Is that you? If so, submit your resume and cover letter and we’ll be in touch!

text:
Product Designer
Join a fast-growing music tech scale-up, where you'll have an impact from your first week.Linkfire is the global leader in smart links for the music streaming industry with 70% market share. Our partners include Warner Music Group, Apple Music, Sony Music, Universal Music Group and many others so if you're passionate about music, you'll fit right in! The music streaming industry is growing quickly with revenues estimated to triple and grow to $75B by 2030. Linkfire recently went public on Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market in Stockholm.As a Product Designer, you will facilitate building the biggest global discovery network in the music industry and connecting creators/artists with fans through a world-class user experience and a distinctive brand. We are looking for a Product Designer with a balanced background of design theory repertoire and practical intuition honed from past experiences.The ideal candidate is curious and collaborative, a Figma / Adobe master with a great sense of aesthetics and a keen eye for detail, and someone who thinks big but is also comfortable with organizing their thoughts in Notion.You will work within a product team to craft end-to-end experiences for our customers and end-users, from discovery sprints to product launches. We are looking for someone who is highly skilled, self-driven, and used to working as part of a product team. You'll be doing research with customers and users, turning insights into awesome interfaces and prototypes, and navigating stakeholders and priorities. Product Designers at Linkfire are given a lot of autonomy and trust to shape and create solutions in close collaboration with their product teams.In this role, you'll report to the Lead Product Designer.What you'll be doingLead design for your product team. Own the end-to-end design process on both large-scale projects and smaller optimizations in close collaboration with the Product Manager; from research and ideation to design, prototyping and user testing. Create guiding user-flows, thoughtful wireframes, and beautiful interfaces. Build design patterns through components, documentation, and best practices.Be the user advocate. Engage with our customers and end-users to understand their needs and frictions, and identify opportunities to address and validate assumptions and ideas. Promote ease of use and always optimise how users interact with our product.Diverge and converge. Know when to quickly explore many rough concepts, flows and sketches, and when to zero in on clever interactions and engaging interface details.Collaborate closely. Besides being an integral part of your product team, you'll work with the rest of Product, Engineering, Customer Success, Marketing and other stakeholders to ensure that what we design, build and ship makes a difference. You will communicate well-annotated design specs for our engineering team.Raise the bar. Work with our Heads of Product and your fellow designers to set the direction for our overall user experience and design system. Contribute to a positive, productive, and passionate design culture.Who you areYou're an excellent communicator with the ability to effectively tell the narrative behind your design work and to engage your stakeholders.You're user-focused and data-informed. Your product instincts and sense for aesthetics are excellent, but you still always strive to validate your work with user feedback and testing.You have a passion for complex problem-solving and can turn insights into concepts, and concepts into awesome designs and experiences.You take initiative and you take responsibility, meaning you are a self-starter that makes things happen, and you are result and solutions-oriented.You collaborate well with others within your own team and across teams and you support others to reach team goals.We'll be excited if youHave experience in the music industry or a passion for musicCare about the impact of your decisions by looking at dataHave an interest in motion and transitional interfacesPush our engineering limits or have coding knowledgeAre actively involved in the design communityBeing a part of the Linkfire team comes withA competitive compensation package, pension contribution and health care benefits, in addition to a laptop and phone / compensating your phone billMonthly mental or physical wellness budgetAbility to work remotely or onsite in our Copenhagen headquarters. We offer relocation to Copenhagen as well.Catered lunch in our Copenhagen office25 days of annual holidays, on top of the standardized festive and bank-related ones, of courseContinual learning and development opportunitiesAn international work environment with many different nationalities and offices in Copenhagen, New York, LA and LisbonGreat support and encouragement from us if you want to host MeetUps, events, etc - we'll help (venue, food etc)Social and team gatheringsMusic has the unique power to unite us all. It transcends cultures, languages, and borders.Every day, we help artists from around the world connect with their fans, and we’re immensely proud to count such a diverse range of creators as our users.We embrace this diversity inside our offices too. At Linkfire, we want you to find a place to belong, and feel encouraged to be your authentic self.We therefore do not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected classification or status.Sounds like you? If so, submit your CV in English and your portfolio. We’ll be in touch!

Influencer Marketing Associate  | Intern
Are you passionate about Social Media, Influencer strategy and obsessed with bringing the most advanced and natural products to market?Scandinavian Biolabs is a rapidly growing online business based in Copenhagen. With the use of natural and vegan ingredients, we advocate innovation through plant-based ingredients and full transparency when it comes to how and where we are producing our products.All components in the hair growth formulas are carefully chosen due to the simple fact that they are natural, healthy, and scientifically proven successful in regenerating hair and increasing activity in the follicles.We are growing at a fast pace across all areas and are intensifying the Influencer Marketing game even further. Hence, we are looking for an ambitious Intern with a passion for social media, influencer collaboration, and testing new ideas working directly with our Social Media & Community Specialist responsible for our online community.Responsibilities:   This position is an opportunity to be a part of an innovative, fast-growing company. As our new team member, you will be working closely with the rest of the company across teams. Most importantly, you will support our Social Media & Community Specialist in everything from developing our Influencer Marketing strategy to executing it.Furthermore, you will be working from our Copenhagen office that we share with other ambitious and fast-growing start-ups providing a highly dynamic and entrepreneurial environment as well as an excellent platform for personal development and knowledge-sharing.What are we promising?An internship tailored to your school's demandsA young, dynamic team of marketing wizards, strategists, product development professionals, ex-management consultants, Amazon experts, and much, much moreWorking directly with our Social Media & Community Specialist and Chief Growth Officer.Investment in your development and the ability to be responsible for a critical part of our growth journeyFlexible working set-up; while we prefer you to be on-site as much as possible (especially because of our great team!), remote working days are completely fineWhat are we looking for?A collaborative thinker who excels in teams while also being independent and self-drivenCreative and entrepreneurial spiritPreferably studying in Copenhagen – e.g. KEA, CBS, or similarIf you have an interest in health, hair, e-commerce, graphic design, and being part of developing a high-growth company, we would love to hear from you.Please include a CV, 10-15 lines about you and your motivation, and any other documents you think are relevant.

Then we have the perfect job opening for you.Digital Designer at ØnskeskyenYou'l become part of our marketing team at Ønskeskyen, and be in charge of the design profile for everything leaving the house branded "Ønskeskyen" from webdesign, ads and banners to presentations, print and events for partners and inhouse. In the position you'll also work with the our external design team about the look and feel, design and UI for Ønskeskyen 2.0.The primary work tasks will be:day to day creative campaigns and tasks.mockups/wireframes for app, web and backend.banners and ads for the website in collaboration with partners.presentations for investors and partners, both digital and printinputs and ideas for the design og UI for Ønskeskyen 2.0.landingpage designs for user sign up campaigns.digital and creative concepts to improve the platform.make design guides to help the marketing team help you with smaller tasks.Who are you? At best you are a digital octopus, with the ability to - while being a team player of course - work individually with the task at hand, and push yourself to find the best graphical solutions, and always push to go the extra mile to get the best result. The tasks will be volatile, so a broad digital profile is what we are looking for - if you can do design, take pictures, know some CSS and can edit a video, great! Let us know. You till be the main in-house creative soul at Ønskeskyen at this point.you love with with the Adobe family and/or Figma and Sketch.It's plus if know CSS and HTML, can edit a video or something else - let us know.you are up to date with the latest trends within design, SoMe and e-commerce.you have a creative mindset, but can work with tight deadlines.you are good at getting the bright ideas, but also putting them into motion and give them life. We are looking for someone to be the creative go-to person at Ønskeskyen.ØnskeskyenWe are first and foremost a wishlist platform with +1.5 million Danish users, but we are aiming to be so much more than that, and that's why we need you to join us on our journey there. Within the next few months Ønskeskyen 2.0 goes live, both in Denmark and in several other markets.With a fresh design and a new name, Ønskeskyen is aiming to become the nr. 1 wishlist app worldwide, but also a personal shopping assistent that you use all year to keep taps on your next purchase, and can buy the stuff you need, when the price is best. On top of that, Ønskeskyen 2.0 will inspire you to find the products you need, and the best gifts for your loved ones.Workplace, compensation and cultureRight at Østerport Station, at what we think is a pretty cool office, you will be closely together with the world class colleagues in marketing team, and will be referring directly to the Commercial Director of Ønskeskyen. We have daily lunch, pension and private health care insurance, the occasional Friday bar and much more . Compensation is negotiated individually based on skill and experience.I would like to apply for the jobTo apply for the please attach your CV and application, possibly also a link to some of your previous work.
