Snr. Project Manager

To support the ambitious goals of Bavarian Nordic and to ensure that we have an aligned and consistent approach to our strategic cross-functional projects and programs, we have just established a Strategy Execution Office. The Strategy Execution Office is a global, centralized unit responsible for driving and supporting our strategic projects and programs with everything from planning, execution and prioritization as well as ensuring proper processes and tools for successful execution.
As Snr. Project Manager you will be part of a dedicated team which currently consist of project managers and coordinators. You will report to VP Strategy Execution. 
Ensure progress and timeliness
In the role as Project Manager/Sr. Project Manager you will have 1-3 projects at any given time - depending on the project complexity, scale, timeframe etc. Your most important task is to drive complex tasks and interact with key internal and external stakeholders and partners. More specifically, your responsibilities will include:
Develop project plans that identify budgetary needs, and secure stakeholder buy-in always
Manage all aspects of cross functional projects and program ensure overall alignment to meet strategic objective incl. in case of scope changes
Define project success criteria and ensure progress reporting incl. plans, interdependencies, risks, and issues
Manage day-to-day activities and chair project team meetings
Support establishment of relevant processes and tools in the newly established Strategy Execution Office including identifying, developing, and maintaining templates and tools using project management techniques to be used across our strategic programs and projects
Can-do mindset- become our new persistent pioneer
The successful candidate should have a relevant scientific background and demonstrate understanding of the nature and challenges of projects within life science and GMP environment. It is expected that you have the following qualifications:

Master of Science degree within Pharmacy, Biology, Analytical Chemistry, or another relevant field
You have completed several complex projects of shorter and longer duration within a GMP production environment (e.g., complex Tech Transfers)
Excellent written and verbal communication in both Danish and English
Leadership qualities to effectively guide and motivate project team, set clear goals, and ensure proper conflict-management
Strong communication skills with colleagues at all organizational levels (Incl. presentational skills – written and verbal)
Strong knowledge of project management processes

Who are we looking for?
As a person you are:

Well-organized and structured which enables you to keep overview in your work and juggle multiple activities simultaneously.
Visualize clear objectives, deadlines, and progress, all while securing regular project meetings.
Able to continuously predict and risk mitigate problems
Meet success criteria and deadlines and individual project budget
You take ownership within your area of responsibility, have a high level of ambition and are eager to achieve sustainable Project Manager competences. The right candidate can follow direction and is productive with minimal supervision.
Some travel activities can be expected (approx. 10 days per year)

We offer
A chance to work in an international company with unique technology and a dedicated work force. We offer a dynamic work environment and an opportunity to develop both your personal and academic competencies. 
Join our transformative journey
At Bavarian Nordic, we aspire to save and improve lives by developing innovative vaccines that are designed to unlock the power of the immune system. We are a global leader in smallpox vaccines and our commercial product portfolio contains market-leading vaccines against rabies and tick-borne encephalitis as well as an Ebola vaccine, licensed to Janssen.
We have embarked upon a truly transformative journey towards becoming one of the largest pure play vaccine companies by excelling in R&D innovation, manufacturing, and commercialization, and are looking for more talent to help drive the change. Come on board our journey and let’s change more lives, together
Do we have your attention?
We are interviewing on an ongoing basis and look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We can’t wait to get to know you better!




Bavarian Nordic is a fully integrated biotechnology company focused on the development, manufacturing and commercialization of live-saving vaccines. The company has a diverse and growing portfolio of vaccines, supported by proprietary development, public-private partnerships and industry collaborations. The company was founded in 1994 and has been listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen Stock Exchange since 1998. Headquartered in Denmark and with operations in Germany, Switzerland and USA, the company employs more than 700 people. Bavarian Nordic is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our culture expresses who we are, and how we interact and communicate with each other, our customers, partners, and shareholders. 
We call our culture ‘Our Bavarian Nordic DNA’ because it is at the heart of everything we do:
PERSISTENT PIONEERS - EMBRACING CHANGE - BOOSTED BY THE TEAM - PROTECTING LIVES EVERY DAY

www.bavarian-nordic.com





  Join Bavarian Nordic and take a step into the future of vaccines. Our goal is to develop innovative and safe therapies against cancer and infectious diseases to improve the health and quality of life for children and adults.  



Apply for position
Application due: 13/05/2022








Follow us






Share/Print

PhD scholarship in Design and Realization of Advanced Devices for Oral Vaccine Delivery



DTU Sundhedsteknologi

























                tirsdag 05 apr 22
            





Send ansøgning

Frist 25. april 2022 
Du kan søge om jobbet ved DTU Sundhedsteknologi ved at udfylde den efterfølgende ansøgningsformular.

Ansøg online




The aim of the PhD project is to explore and develop micrometer to mm-sized devices that are suited for oral administration of vaccines. Our focus will be on i) facilitating delivery at specific locations in the gut and ii) enhancing retention time of the devices. Within the framework of IDUN, we have extensively explored engineered micro-encapsulated pharmaceutical compounds and more advanced oral drug delivery concepts in order to enable seeding of probiotics, delivery of vaccines and enhanced systemic uptake of e.g. peptide therapeutics such as insulin. In addition, we have focused on developing fabrication methods that are suited for mass production of micro- and macroscale devices for the gastrointestinal tract. The PhD candidate will be a part of the IDUN center of excellence, led by Prof. Anja Boisen at DTU Department of Health Technology. IDUN is a highly cross-disciplinary research center with over 40 members, that focuses on development of micro and nanotechnology based sensors, detection systems and drug delivery devices.

Research field
The PhD student will primarily be working on the design, realisation and characterization of polymeric devices for vaccine delivery. New fabrication methods and delivery concepts will be explored, as well as new ways of increasing retention time. The work will be carried out in close collaboration with colleagues and IDUN project partners related to device designs, vaccine formulations and bioimaging. The devices will be developed in an iterative manner and the loading with vaccine formulations need to be an integral part of the design and fabrication. In vivo testing as well as bioimaging will be part of the device characterization. 

Responsibilities and tasks
You will be responsible for device design and fabrication as well as the associated in situ, ex vivo and in vivo characterization of the realised devices. This work will be carried out in close collaboration with you colleagues at DTU Health Tech as well as our collaborators at Statens Serum Institut (SSI). You are expected to have a background in materials science and/or microfabrication technologies. You are highly independent, self-motivated and enjoy collaboration in a multidisciplinary academic environment. You have the ability to drive the project forward, supervise students and achieve ambitious goals. 

The work will be carried out within the framework of the Center of Excellence – IDUN. In IDUN, our motto is ‘bringing science to life’ and we believe in openness, inclusiveness, having ambitions, making a difference and collaboration.

You will play a role in the drug delivery part of the research section, interacting with several members working in different disciplines, such as biology, microfabrication, pharmaceutical science and polymer science. The project is highly interdisciplinary and we expect that you enjoy teamwork and are good at coordinating you work with your colleagues.  

Qualifications
You must have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree.

The ideal candidate has a background in polymer fabrication or materials science with an emphasis on materials that are suitable for inclusion in oral dosage forms. You are expected to have a keen interest in medical devices. In addition, experience with drug delivery, vaccine formulation and in vitro and in vivo experiments will be considered a major plus. If you have another background that fits the overall scope of the project you are of course also welcome to apply.  

Approval and Enrolment
The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education.   

We offer
DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.

Salary and appointment terms
The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years.You can read more about career paths at DTU here.

Further information
Further information may be obtained from senior consultant/specialist Lasse H. E. Thamdrup (lhth@dtu.dk), postdoc Rolf Bech Kjeldsen (rbeck@dtu.dk), Head of Vaccine Adjuvant Research, Dennis Christensen (den@ssi.dk) and Prof. Anja Boisen (aboi@dtu.dk).

You can read more about DTU Health Tech at www.healthtech.dtu.dk/english.

Application procedure
Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 25 April 2022 (Danish time). Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply online", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file. The file must include:

A letter motivating the application (cover letter)
Curriculum vitae 
Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale

You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it.

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.

DTU Health Tech
DTU Health Tech engages in research, education, and innovation base on technical and natural science for the healthcare sector. The Healthcare sector is a globally expanding market with demands for the most advanced technological solutions. DTU Health Tech creates the foundation for companies to develop new and innovative services and products which benefit people and create value for society. DTU Health Techs expertise spans from imaging and biosensor techniques, across digital health and biological modelling, to biopharma technologies. The department has a scientific staff of about 210 persons, 140 PhD students and a technical/administrative support staff of about 160 persons, of which a large majority contributes to our research infrastructure and related commercial activities.

Technology for people
DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear vision to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That vision lives on today. DTU has 12,900 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.

Du kan søge om jobbet ved DTU Sundhedsteknologi ved at udfylde den efterfølgende ansøgningsformular.

Ansøg online




We are looking for a structured and scientific minded colleague to fill a 3-year PhD position available in our brain metabolism group. You will be working with state-of-the-art technical equipment – a clinical 3T MRI scanner equipped with hyperpolarization – to study the metabolically declining brain non-invasively and in real-time with the aim to translate methodologies to the clinic.

Background
Metabolic imaging is an attractive tool for the study of integrative physiology as it provides the means to measure cellular function in vivo in single cells, tissue, organs or organisms. Magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS) is a widely used imaging method for studying in vivo metabolism non-invasively. Adding hyperpolarization in the form of dissolution dynamic nuclear polarization (dDNP) to the MRS enhances the MR signal and allows us to trace healthy and aberrant metabolism specifically through biochemical conversion of the contrast agent in vivo. The MR signal enhancement of the metabolic contrast agent translates generally into reduction of hours long scan times and/or better resolution and most importantly can add dynamical information to the metabolic images. Hyperpolarized MR is currently (using specific endogenous molecules as metabolic contrast agent) translated to human studies with several early-phase clinical trials in progress including early reports showing 13C-pyruvate to 13C-lactate metabolism in healthy human brain.

At Hypermag in the section for magnetic resonance at DTU Health Tech we are experts in hyperpolarized MR and we will during spring 2022 install a clinical 3T MR scanner at DTU. We are therefore looking for you if you are interested in new technology, imaging and brain metabolism and are willing to work hard in a dedicated team of colleagues to make hyperpolarized MR at DTU a method for clinical translational metabolic research.

Responsibilities and tasks
This PhD project aims at investigating causal links between metabolic syndrome (MetS), neuro-inflammation, neuro-metabolism and neurodegenerative disorders. We will study this in a physiological context relevant for clinical translation. Specifically in diet-induced obesity in a pig model that validly mimics the human diet-induced obese /MetS condition. In particular, the Ossabaw pig breed available at DTU Health Tech will be used as model system.

In the PhD project the set-up and tests of all tools needed to successfully conduct valuable biological studies will be implemented and evaluated in collaboration with team members in the brain metabolism group. Those tools include optimal spectroscopic sequences, a multi-nuclei head coil, hyperpolarized 13C-tracer production and injection protocols and anesthetic and monitoring protocols.    

As a PhD student in the section for magnetic resonance you are expected to:

Contribute to research-based education of bachelor and master students
Take responsibility, as a member of the brain metabolism group, for high quality performance on instrumentation for hyperpolarized magnetic resonance spectroscopy and on the 3T clinical scanner
3-6 months exchange visit to one of our international collaborators who are frontrunners on hyperpolarized magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Engage in collaborations across DTU Health Tech and between metabolism and MR groups at KU Pharma and Århus University hospital.

Qualifications
These contributions require a combination of interests and skills, and we are specifically looking for a person who has

Experience with data analysis 
Flair for and interest in experimental work
Interest in metabolic imaging
Experience with Matlab or Python programming, or other relevant software for hardware control and data modelling
Good self- and project management skills

It is necessary for an applicant for this interdisciplinary project to be naturally interested and take active participation in these connected scientific research fields related to the project: metabolism, biochemistry, molecular biology and pharmacology.

You must have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree.

Approval and Enrolment
The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education.

DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.

Salary and appointment terms
The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years.

You can read more about career paths at DTU here. 

Further information
Further information may be obtained from the main supervisor, Dr. Mathilde Hauge Lerche, phone: +45 5362 4555 or email: mhauler@dtu.dk and from the co-supervisor, Dr. Rie Beck Olin, email: rbeha@dtu.dk. 

You can read more about DTU Health Tech at www.healthtech.dtu.dk/english, the section for magnetic resonance at www.cmr.healthtech.dtu.dk and specifically about Hypermag at www.hypermag.dtu.dk. 

If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark.

Application procedure
Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 28 April 2022 (Danish time). Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. Curriculum vitae

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

Facility Manager for the Translational Imaging Center



DTU Sundhedsteknologi

























                fredag 01 apr 22
            





Send ansøgning

Frist 18. april 2022 
Du kan søge om jobbet ved DTU Sundhedsteknologi ved at udfylde den efterfølgende ansøgningsformular.

Ansøg online




Practical and visionary team builder

We are looking for an experienced and skilled hands-on facility manager who will help us build an open access, cross-modal bioimaging infrastructure at DTU.

Our vision for the Translational Imaging Center (TIC) is to create an excellent infrastructure for research, education and innovation in, and with, advanced bioimaging technologies. TIC is expected to grow organically by gradually establishing open access to state-of-the-art imaging equipment. We will do this by making groundbreaking DTU bio-imaging technology and knowledge available through project collaboration and by creating strong accessible networks to regional hospitals and industry.

Medical imaging is pivotal in studying the inner workings of the human body non-invasively and a bioimaging infrastructure should be made available to all departments at DTU. TIC is administered from Department of Health Technology (DTU Health Tech) due to our wide knowledge base in a range of physical principles including x-rays, ultrasound, light, magnetic resonance and electrical signals and our common purpose to provide better healthcare solutions for the benefit of society and patients.

TIC will house several activities: 

Clinical 3T Magnetic resonance imaging and spectroscopy for non-invasive imaging of biochemical processes in living systems 
Clinical ultrasound for 3D flow, pressure gradients and estimation, super resolution to study the microvasculature in real-time on humans 
Clinical optical imaging for functional optical imaging and microscopy for deep tissue imaging, multimodal imaging for non-invasive cancer diagnostics, guiding surgery and tissue resection, opto-acoustics imaging for deep tissue imaging
Small animal fluorescence and bioluminescence, SPECT/PET/CT for contrast agent development and drug delivery

Responsibilities and qualifications
Your focus will be on gradually building up and correspondingly putting in place infrastructure (equipment and tools around these), access and behavioral rules for daily management in a growing imaging facility.

You will be working closely together with the head of the translational imaging center in all aspects around building the facility.

With new imaging equipment we need to build up local protocols, ethics, and strategies for pre-clinical imaging of small and larger animals. You will be an active contributor in this work.

We are a new facility with growth ambition, and we are dependent on good and collaborative interaction with surrounding established DTU facilities and departments. We thus expect you to bridge competences and interests between different parts of the DTU organization and DTU Health Tech, especially to the Animal Facility and to Campus Service.

It is our ambition to become a bio-imaging facility for all DTU and to create ownership and interest for the diverse imaging technologies by linking up to the strong knowledge base within our Health Technology department. You are therefore expected to work together with appointed experts in imaging methods and expert users of imaging equipment to create units of expertise around each technology in the facility. This will involve creating means of user sharing and expert teaching for user groups.

We expect you to have experience with building up an imaging facility and to have practical experience with training of colleagues, maintenance of imaging equipment, writing SOPs and standard protocols for equipment use. Strong experience with all types of daily operations in an animal facility is a pre-requisite. If you have experience and interest in surgical work on larger animals, this will be regarded as a plus. Also, it will be highly valuable if you are accredited to work with radioactive isotopes.

We are seeking a new facility manager for the Translational imaging Center at DTU with the following competencies: 

At least 5 years of practical experience with procedures and care for animals in research
Administrative and practical experience as facility manager
Solution-oriented 
Eagerness to bring the competencies of others into play
Capacity to balance of work that involves both routine and creative tasks
Work with trust and responsibility as key values

In return we offer you the privilege of working in a small team with large ambitions and positive energy. A team that cares highly about relations (internal and external to the team) and where we work with trust, telling and sharing as our work compass. 

As an employee at DTU Health Tech, we offer you an interesting and challenging job in an international atmosphere with the focus on research, teaching, innovation and scientific advice for the benefit of the surrounding community. We place emphasis on a high level of professionalism among our staff, so development of skills is an integral part of our organization. We offer a great flexibility in the position.

Salary and appointment terms
Salary and employment terms in accordance with the OAO-S Joint Agreement and the organization agreement for Engineering Assistants and Research Technicians at research institutions etc. or other relevant organization agreement. Starting date is as soon as possible. 

Application and contact
Please submit your online application no later than 18 April 2022 (Danish time). Open the “Apply online” link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, CV and exam certificates. 

If you would like additional information about the position, please contact Head of TIC, Mathilde Hauge Lerche, on phone 5362 4555.

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.

DTU Health Tech engages in research, education, and innovation base on technical and natural science for the healthcare sector. The Healthcare sector is a globally expanding market with demands for the most advanced technological solutions. DTU Health Tech creates the foundation for companies to develop new and innovative services and products which benefit people and create value for society. DTU Health Techs expertise spans from imaging and biosensor techniques, across digital health and biological modelling, to biopharma technologies. The department has a scientific staff of about 210 persons, 140 PhD students and a technical/administrative support staff of about 160 persons, of which a large majority contributes to our research infrastructure and related commercial activities. Read more about at www.healthtech.dtu.dk/english.   

Technology for people
DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear vision to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That vision lives on today. DTU has 12,900 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.

Du kan søge om jobbet ved DTU Miljø ved at udfylde den efterfølgende ansøgningsformular.

Ansøg online




Kan du godt lide en arbejdsplads med afvekslende opgaver samt gode muligheder for faglig og personlig udvikling?
DTU Miljø søger en engageret og selvstændig laborant til en hverdag i vores analyselaboratorier, og som trives godt med både forskning og undervisningsopgaver.
Om jobbet
Stillingen indebærer laboratoriearbejde i vores analyselaboratorier, herunder deltagelse i forskningsprojekter samt vejledning af studerende. Vores opgaver udvikler sig løbende og du kan se frem til en alsidig arbejdsdag, hvor du bliver tilknyttet forskellige forskningsprojekter og undervisningsopgaver for vores studerende på Institut for Miljø- og Ressourceteknologi. Stillingen indebærer også forskellige driftsopgaver på tværs af hele laborant/tekniker-gruppen, såsom indkøb af kemikalier og andet laboratorieudstyr, samt ansvar for og løbende drift og vedligeholdelse/opdatering af forskelligt apparatur, herunder oplæring af nye brugere.
Din baggrund og kompetencer
Du har sikkert en uddannelse som laborant, professionsbachelor i laboratorieteknologi, ingeniør eller kemiker.
Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med nogle af følgende miljøkemiske analyser

Kemisk analyse af organiske forbindelser med HPLC, LC-MS, GC og GC-MS
Kemisk analyse af metaller ved hjælp af ICP-MS
Kemiske standard analysemetoder, såsom brugen af Hach-lange kit, Kjeldahl, COD analyser, Segmented Flow Analyzer (Skalar) og TOC 

Du trives i et arbejdsmiljø, hvor arbejdsdagen byder på mange forskelige typer af opgaver og måske ikke altid forløber som planlagt. Du er udadvendt, og fungerer naturligt som ’go to’-personen for både forskere og studerende, når de har brug for din hjælp i laboratoriet, hvor du indgår i den daglige drift med dine kolleger i vores teknikergruppe. 
Mange af vores ansatte, studerende og gæster kommer fra udlandet og vores arbejdssprog er ofte engelsk. Derfor er gode mundtlige engelskkundskaber vigtige, mens gode mundtlige og skriftlige dansk kundskaber også er en fordel, men ikke et krav. Der er en høj grad af selvledelse i jobbet og det er derfor vigtigt at du formår at tage ansvar og prioritere dine opgaver i høj grad selv. Idet arbejdet koordineres med kolleger og forskere er det også væsentligt at du er god til at samarbejde. 
Din arbejdsplads
Tekniker/laborant-gruppen på Institut for Miljø- og Ressourceteknologi består af ca. 30 medarbejdere fordelt på flere laboratorier på DTU og Risø campus. Vi dækker mange forskellige kompetencer og arbejdsopgaver inden for feltarbejde (elektronik, automatisering, programmering af udstyr, pumper, radioøkologi) og laboratoriearbejde (organisk og uorganisk kemi, økotoksikologi, bio-reaktor opsætning, mikrobiologi og molekylærbiologi, geologi, konstruktion og indeklima). Dit primære tilhørsforhold vil være i kromatografigruppen sammen med 3 andre analyseteknikere. Kromatografigruppen er en del af en større teknikergruppe på DTU campus som arbejder tæt sammen og du kommer derfor til at indgå i direkte samspil med alle instituttets laboranter, teknikere, studerende og forskere.   
Institut for Miljø- og Ressourceteknologi er en af de førende forsknings- og uddannelsesinstitutioner på miljøområdet i Europa. Vi prioriterer tværgående samarbejde mellem forskningsområder og personalegrupper i et internationalt aktivt uddannelses- og forskningsmiljø til gavn for det danske samfund.
Vi tilbyder 

En arbejdsplads i konstant udvikling og med mulighed for kontinuert faglig og personlig udvikling
En bred vifte af spændende opgaver i dit daglige arbejdsliv
En høj grad af fleksibilitet i dit arbejdsliv, da du får stor indflydelse på at planlægge arbejdet inden for dit ansvarsområde
Et interessant og udfordrende job i en international atmosfære med fokus på forskning, undervisning, innovation og videnskabelig rådgivning til gavn for det omgivende samfund. Vi lægger vægt på et højt niveau af professionalisme blandt vores medarbejdere, så kompetenceudvikling er en integreret del af vores organisation. 

Løn- og aftalevilkår
Løn- og ansættelsesvilkår sker i henhold til overenskomst for OAO-S-fællesoverenskomsten og organisationsaftale for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og IT-medarbejdere (HK/Stat) indgået med Finansministeriet eller i henhold til overenskomst for akademikere i staten.
Stillingen er på fuld tid med start 1. juni 2022 eller senere efter aftale.
Arbejdspladsen er på DTU i Lyngby.
Ansøgning og kontakt
Indsend din online ansøgning på dansk eller engelsk senest den mandag den 2. maj 2022. Åbn linket "Ansøg online", udfyld formularen og vedhæft din motiverede ansøgning, CV og eksamensbeviser.
Hvis du ønsker yderligere oplysninger om stillingen, bedes du kontakte professor Philipp Mayer på +45 45251569, philm@env.dtu.dk
Alle interesserede kandidater uanset alder, køn, race, handicap, religion eller etnisk baggrund opfordres til at ansøge.
Teknologi for mennesker
DTU udvikler teknologi for mennesker. Med vores forskning og uddannelser i international topklasse er vi med til at skabe en bedre verden, og vi bidrager til løsningen af de globale udfordringer formuleret i FN’s 17 verdensmål for en bæredygtig udvikling. H.C. Ørsted grundlagde DTU i 1829 med en klar vision om at udvikle og nyttiggøre naturvidenskab og teknisk videnskab til gavn for samfundet. Den vision lever den dag i dag. DTU har 12.900 studerende og 6.000 ansatte. Vi arbejder i en international atmosfære og har et inkluderende, udviklende og uformelt arbejdsmiljø. DTU har campusser i hele Danmark og i Grønland og samarbejder med de bedste universiteter verden over.

Du kan søge om jobbet ved DTU Energi ved at udfylde den efterfølgende ansøgningsformular.

Ansøg online




The Department of Energy Conversion and Storage, Technical University of Denmark (DTU), invites applications for a PhD scholarship in developing new routes to synthesis of ammonia at low temperature.
The research project is part of the Villum Center for the Science of Sustainable Fuels and Chemicals (V-SUSTAIN), which brings together researchers from the Technical University of Denmark, University of Copenhagen, and University of Southern Denmark, among others.  
Synthesis of ammonia accounts for more than 1 % of the global energy consumption and more than 1 % of the CO2 emissions. The future demand of ammonia is expected to increase, not only due to population growth, but also because ammonia is considered a potential low emission fuel for global shipping. Hence, more efficient synthesis processes associated with no or reduced emissions will be key to realizing climate policy goals. It is highly advantageous if novel ammonia synthesis routes can be down scaled and are compliant with the characteristics of the future energy system, where electricity cost and availability will vary due to fluctuating production.        
Responsibilities and qualifications
The successful candidate will work on developing and experimentally verifying novel routes to the synthesis of ammonia. Focus will be on process schemes that can be applied at small scale and are primarily driven by electricity and will enable ammonia synthesis at lower temperature and pressure than state of the art today. Within the framework of V-SUSTAIN it has recently been found that ternary hydrides (Li/Ba-Ru-hydrides) offer markedly improved ammonia production rates at ambient pressure between 50 and 300oC.  This class of materials will be sought further developed and experimentally verified. In addition, the work will address how metal halide salts (e.g. MnCl2)) can be used to improve overall ammonia production rates. Such salts can benefit ammonia synthesis by reducing the ammonia activity during synthesis and thereby boost the formation rate. One can also use such salts for capturing ammonia from gas mixtures where it is present in low concentration e.g. from a low temperature synthesis route of poor selectivity. The captured ammonia can later be extracted in concentrated form by a pressure swing or temperature swing type operation. Such operation mode will be well suited for intermittent operation in a system with varying electricity cost.  
The project will be carried out in close collaboration with the theory groups in the Villum Center V-SUSTAIN, that work on the fundamental description of the reaction pathway and on identifying novel and superior catalysts. It is an aim to verify experimentally, novel catalysts predicted from these materials modelling activities. 

Your research will include establishing/modifying setups for characterising ammonia synthesis involving use of auxiliary ammonia getter materials. 
Your research will include experimental characterisation of reaction kinetics   
Your tasks will involve detailed materials characterisation and synthesis of novel catalyst materials. 
As part of the PhD education, you will follow courses and assist in teaching activities
You are expected to spend at least 3 months at a foreign research institution
You will disseminate your work in international peer reviewed journals and at professional conferences.

Candidates should have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree.
We favour candidates with a degree in chemical engineering, chemistry, physics or materials science or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a master's degree in engineering. Experience with one or more of the following areas is considered an advantage; 

Materials synthesis, 
Experimental characterisation of reaction kinetics 
Materials characterisation 
Heterogeneous catalysis and/or electrochemistry

Moreover, the successful candidate

is innovative and able to work in cross-disciplinary teams 
has good communication skills in English, both written and spoken
is able to work independently and take responsibility for the progress and quality of projects.

Approval and Enrolment 
The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education. 
Assessment
Your application will be assessed by Professor Peter Vang Hendriksen and Dev. Eng. Xiufu Sun.  
We offer
DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.
Salary and appointment terms
The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years.
You can read more about career paths at DTU here.
Further information
Further information may be obtained from Professor Peter Vang Hendriksen. Please do not send applications to these e-mail addresses, instead apply online as described below. 
You can read more DTU Energy at www.energy.dtu.dk 
If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark. 
Application
Please submit your online application no later than 25 April 2022 (Danish time). 
Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply online", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file. The file must include:

A letter motivating the application (cover letter)
Curriculum vitae 
Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale

Candidates may apply prior to ob­tai­ning their master's degree but cannot begin before having received it. 
Applications and enclosures received after the deadline will not be considered.
All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.
DTU Energy
The Department of Energy Conversion and Storage is focusing on functional materials and their application in sustainable energy technology. Our research areas include fuel cells, electrolysis, polymer solar cells, magnetic refrigeration, superconductivity, thermoelectrics, sustainable synthetic fuels, and batteries. The Department, which has more than 200 employees, was founded in 2012. Additional information about the department can be found on www.energy.dtu.dk
Technology for people
DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear vision to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That vision lives on today. DTU has 12,900 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.

Would you like be part of the green energy transition and play a significant role in Topsoeo’s Power-to-X mission? Research Scientist in Enzyme Research, R&D, Novozymes




Job Ad


Do you want to rethink your impact, and are you passionate about bringing enzymes faster to the market? Then, you might be our new Research Scientist within Enzyme Research.What if you could work for a cause, not just a company?Novozymes is the global market leader in biological solutions. We help build better lives. Together with our customers, partners and the global community, we use our innovative thinking and passion for science to boost industries and make everyday products more sustainable for the good of the planet. As the world’s leading provider of industrial enzymes and microorganisms, our bio-innovation enables higher agricultural yields, low-temperature washing, energy-efficient production, renewable fuel and many, many other biological solutions that the world can benefit from today and in the future. We call it Rethink Tomorrow. Welcome to department PrototypingWith this position, you will together with 24 dedicated colleagues be part of department Prototyping with focus on producing, purifying, and characterizing enzyme prototypes. In the department, we value and prioritize a good working atmosphere and are organized in agile teams helping each other out when needed. Together with 10 colleagues from dept. Prototyping, you will join an agile team (‘Prototype Production and Purification Enabler team’) dedicated to fermentation, harvest and purification of enzymes – the latter being our main focus. In the team, we enable fast progress of projects across different industries in Novozymes R&D. The department is part of the functional area ‘Prototyping, Analytics and Data Management’.Join us as our new Research Scientist in Enzyme Research, R&DAs a research scientist in the Prototype production and purification team you will be dedicated to producing enzyme prototypes for our stakeholders internally in Novozymes R&D as well as our external customers / collaborators.In this role you’ll make an impact by:Fermentation and harvest of enzyme from cells (using standard methods described by key experts in Novozymes R&D)Purification of enzyme from cell broth supernatantOptimizing, automating, and standardizing our processes both within laboratory work and data treatment to ensure efficient and robust workflowsSupporting laboratory technicians when they need helpEnabling new discoveries and innovation by providing enzyme prototypes to R&D projects across different industriesTo succeed you must: Have a MSc in protein chemistry, biochemistry, biotechnology, or related field of science and preferably, at least 1-3 years of experiences in an industrial settingHave a solid background in protein chemistry – especially protein purificationHave experience with different chromatography techniques, ÄKTA systems, and UNICORN softwareEnjoy providing a service to our customers (internal and external) and optimizing workflowsBe interested in actively participating with work in the laboratoriesPreferably, have experience with automated liquid handlersPreferably, have an interest in or flair for automated data management (e.g. scripting in Python or using other tools)Be a team player motivated by common goals and collaborationLocation: This job will be in Denmark at our Innovation Campus in LyngbyAre you passionate about making a sustainable impact, and do you see yourself in this position? Then unlock your passion and apply today!Application deadline: April 24th 2022.Contact details: If you need further information, please contact research scientist Gustav Hansen (gvhh@novozymes.com) or  Department Manager Marie Kruse (mtho@novozymes.com).Not the right fit for you?If this job for some reason is not the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting? If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage him or her to apply. Thank you for your referral. Please check out our other open positions. Maybe the right fit for you is just a few clicks away.Want to learn more? Did you know, that Novozymes was ranked #7 in Science magazine’s global Top Employers Survey 2019?At Novozymes, we invite you to join us in finding biological solutions to the world’s problems. Being a pioneering company, we seek people, who are eager to try new things, motivated by challenge and not afraid to fail but driven to try again. And again. Original thinking happens when we’re given the flexibility to focus and the freedom to fully unfold our individual strengths. This is key to our innovation power and how we have become one of the top patent holders in the biotech industry. Learn more about Novozymes, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novozymes.com. Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

Scientist or Sr. Scientist, Nucleotide Chemistry/Oligonucleotide Synthesis

Ceptur Therapeutics ApS
 Kgs. Lyngby

Indrykket 8. april 2022



 Ceptur Therapeutics is a growing biotech, with a biology team in Philadelphia and a chemistry team in Denmark developing unique and differentiated genetic medicines for patients with unaddressed diseases. The Company’s wholly owned and proprietary U1 Adaptor technology promotes non-genotoxic and long-lasting silencing of disease-causing genes in difficult to target tissues (i.e., outside of the liver and CNS). 

Role Summary:

 We are currently seeking a motivated and creative scientist with expertise in solid phase oligonucleotide synthesis to join our growing nucleotide/oligonucleotide chemistry and delivery team. In this position, you will play a key role in building up Ceptur’s synthetic chemistry group and set up new synthesis/purification workflows and labs to produce high quality synthetic oligonucleotides for research and preclinical drug development. The successful candidate will have significant experience with hands-on operation of lab-scale oligonucleotide synthesizers. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a cross-functional role and excel as part of a diverse team. 

Specific responsibilities include:

Develop, establish, and evaluate solid-phase synthesis and downstream purification and analytical methods of guide natural and chemically modified oligonucleotides
Execute solid phase syntheses to produce high quality U1 adaptors with chemical modifications to support Ceptur’s research programs
Actively evaluate effectiveness of the oligonucleotides synthesis and improve synthetic, purification, and analytical protocols
Provide technical guidance on design and chemical modifications for small to mid-scale synthesis of lU1 adaptors for in vitro and in vivo screening
Author, review, and approve protocols, SOPs, technical documents, and reports for synthesis lab
Independently plan and execute experiments, perform data analysis and interpretation
Deliver reproducible and impactful results under ambitious timelines
Maintain thorough electronic lab notebooks and documentation records, and present findings to multi-disciplinary teams in various oral and written formats
Adhere to all laboratory safety requirements and procedures, assist in maintaining general laboratory functionality, including lab equipment maintenance and the ordering, and receiving of lab supplies

Education:

PhD in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, or related field.

Required Skills:

0-5 years of experience in an industrial setting
Deep understanding of solid phase oligonucleotide synthesis chemistry, anion-exchange chromatography, reverse-phase chromatography, and size-exclusion chromatography
Demonstrated competency in setting up and operating lab-scale oligonucleotide synthesizers, such as MerMade 12, MerMade 48X, AKTA OligoPilot 100 and Dr oligo 48
Demonstrated competency in HPLC/UPLC purifications, analysis, and characterization methods of oligonucleotides
Highly self-motivated, driven, can-do, make it happen attitude with ability to own and drive projects

Preferred Skills:

Experience with analytical techniques for the analysis of chemically modified DNA/RNA oligonucleotides, such as HPLC/UPLC, UV thermal melting, LC-UV-Fluor, and LC-MS
Strong collaborator with cross-functional teams and external partners
Capable of continuous learning, open-minded, curious, highly organized, and meticulous

We offer:

 A collaborative and rewarding work environment with cutting edge scientific exploration. Ceptur offers an attractive compensation program with a competitive benefits package. 

How to apply:

 Please send cover letter and full CV by 1st May the latest to Executive Assistant Dorte Dannemann at ddannemann@cepturtx.com. Applications will be evaluated on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible. 



 This description is not intended to be constructed as an exhaustive list of duties, responsibilities, or requirements for the position. Do you want to be a part of the world’s leading jewellery company while putting your experience in technology into use? If yes, then we might have an exciting opportunity for you! You will be part of an exciting digital & tech area and work in an international organisation of can-do spirited, passionate, and performance-driven people. We value flexibility and informal working, where you are trusted to deliver and to focus on outcomes and value.
 
About the Team: 

Building an E2E integrated and agile supply chain is a key pillar on our Digital strategy to deliver on our company ambitions and our promise to consumers and customers. We are embracing a scaled Agile setup structured around product teams with clear focus on business outcomes.  Strong and passionate
Product Management is a key component of realizing these ambitions. In this newly created role, you will help to shape the direction and supply chain product domain as part of the functional leadership team to ensure Pandora is putting technology at the heart of evolving our business and delivering growth.
 
Within Omni Operations, you will work to deliver the new Digital strategy and the Omni Operations 2026 strategy and the ambition of creating a flexible fulfilment and delivery setup across our value chain globally. You will work together within the Product Line and collaborate with stakeholders from technology, distribution centres and global Operations to realize our shared strategic ambitions. You will focus on product management in order to help shape and implement a new ecosystem for fulfilment (WMS) and delivery (TMS) capabilities globally, better enabling us to deliver on our end-consumer needs.
 
Your role as a Product Manager:
 
As a product manager you will act as the connector between functional needs and technology and ensure we are always working on the things that creates value for our consumers and the business. You will holistically support the product management process, the community of product managers as well as business analysts and SMEs to ensure we are always clear on the “what” and “why” within the Omni Operations product line, representing the voice of the customer.  
 
You will support the product line lead and team product managers in acting as the voice of our customers and translate their needs into product vision, objectives, roadmap, and corresponding team backlog. 
 
Supporting across the product line in aligning the prioritization and dependencies of the backlog will be of utter importance to optimize and realize beneficial improvements for the business. As we are working in a newly established setup, you should also expect assignments outside the normal boundaries of product management (e.g. architecture, delivery, etc.) to help ensure the success and continued maturity journey of the Omni Operations product line. Key accountabilities include: 
 

Support the Product line product mgmt. lead and the product managers in creating product visions, roadmaps, epics, etc. for the Omni Operations area. Drive explorative work in relation to customer and business problems and opportunities
Help functional consultants, business analysts and business SMEs in analysis and functional deep dives, such as orchestrating solution assessments across end-user and product teams.  
Support the product line lead in establishing and maturing the disciplines and ways of working in relation to product management (product maps, data driven product management, epic refinement, etc.) 
Help foster strong collaboration across teams to drive shared product refinement work and improved realization of benefits during execution, incl. emphasis on end-user adoption and clear stakeholder mgmt. communication
Support product line leadership and the overall product line with ad-hoc assignments and initiatives, ranging from practical tasks of preparing quarterly planning event to complex strategic deep dive assignments aiding the lead solution architect.   

 
What is needed to succeed:

People Leader for merchant risk management team








































Apply now























                            People Leader for merchant risk management team
                        

                             Gentofte
                        




Imagine a future where you’re leading a team of skilled risk managers, responsible for all energy risk from a large portfolio of renewable assets.

 Join us in this role where you’ll be leading the Merchant Risk Continental Europe team who has the overall responsibility for ensuring best-in-class risk management of the production and of the energy market price risk from our operating assets and energy contracts on the European Continent. That includes a large portfolio of offshore wind farms with varied complex non-linear subsidy structures, power sales agreements, power plants, and gas sourcing contracts. You’ll have a risk leadership role in the centre of the green transformation in the most volatile period that the European energy markets has ever seen. 

Welcome to Merchant Risk

 You’ll be part of our Merchant Risk Continental Europe team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for understanding the nature of our assets, variability of production, and risk governance. You’ll be hedging frameworks and mandates as well as understanding and overseeing potential residual risks that arise from the risk management strategies. The team consists of seven curious, bright, and ambitious people primarily with experience from the energy or financial sector. The Merchant Risk department consists of four teams, one is located in the US and three in Denmark. 

You’ll play an important role in:

leading and developing a team of highly capable risk managers while ensuring a high degree of cooperation and knowledge sharing across the teams in the department
driving performance within the team through a structured approach to delegating tasks and projects while ensuring completion within agreed time
using your strong risk management mindset and experience in sparring with team members, management peers, and your own manager
understanding and being on top of all energy related risk associated with Ørsted’s Continental European wind farms, power plant, and energy contracts
continuously evaluating current hedging initiatives and the realised impact on the financial performance of the assets and providing input on stress scenarios that could hurt the portfolio revenue.

To succeed in the role, you:

possess great leadership skills and have experience as manager of a team
have solid experience with market risk management or similar, and have a good understanding of derivatives, risk models, and hedging strategies
are a team player and see the success of the team as your own success, and are motivated by being part of a closely linked management team
are a good communicator of complex topics, both verbally, in writing, and through presentations, and you can share your opinions in open discussions while being ready to change your mind based on the dialogue and good arguments
have a master’s degree within a relevant area – e.g., finance, economics, mathematics – or an alternative background with strong relevant experience
are a fast learner who quickly understands complex structures.

Join a world leader in green energy

 Ørsted is a global leader in offshore wind energy and ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company. To be a frontrunner, we invest significantly in employee development, and from the moment you join us, we’ll support your personal and professional growth. Here, you’ll get the opportunities that will unleash your full potential, and you’ll experience a collaborative, diverse, and dynamic work environment. 

Shape the future with us

 Send your application to us no later than 21 April 2022. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate. 


 Please don’t hesitate to contact Jonas Prisum Brandt, Director, on +45 9955 4333 if you’d like to know more about the position. 


 If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements. 


 We offer a flexible workplace, and, in this position, you’ll be working in an office-based set-up. 


 Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. 



Apply now

        Assistant Professor of Advanced Water Analysis in Environmental Analytical Chemistry
    

The Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences (PLEN), Faculty of Science, University of Copenhagen invites applications for a four-year Assistant Professor position within the area of “Advanced Water Analysis in Environmental Analytical Chemistry”. The position is open from 1 July 2022 or as soon as possible thereafter.
PLEN covers research and teaching within Agriculture, Biotechnology and Environment and is divided into nine sections with focus on plants, microorganisms, animals and the environment. The department seeks to stimulate fundamental research and the synergy between basic and applied research in biology and environmental science. The Assistant Professor will be affiliated to Section for Environmental Chemistry and Physics, located at the Frederiksberg campus, and is expected to collaborate within and contribute to the good working environment of the section.
The main responsibility of the Assistant Professor will be to strengthen the department’s research profile in advanced water analysis by liquid and supercritical fluid chromatography (LC/SFC) – (high resolution) mass spectrometry (HRMS). The position aims to strengthen this research area, especially the increasing demand for the analysis of very polar compounds in water due to the increasing need for safe and clean water worldwide. This position should provide expertise in improving analytical methods for the detection of relevant, so far unknown chemicals, as well as increasing the knowledge of emerging compound. Another part is interpreting the data, to understand the fate of chemicals in the aquatic environment, as well as to design solutions for the treatment of these. Especially evaluation of treatment technologies regarding the formation of transformation products, needs more expertise research.
The Assistant Professor’s duties will primarily include research, including obligations with regard to publication/scientific communication and research-based teaching with associated examination obligations within analytical chemistry and chemical fingerprinting. To a limited extent this may also include performance of other duties.
Required qualifications
The successful candidate should be able to document:

A PhD in analytical chemistry, chromatography and mass spectrometry, non-target analysis or equivalent.
Research experience and publication record within the subject areas listed in the job description, at a level equivalent to that of an assistant professor.
Experience with LC-HRMS and SFC-HRMS instruments
Experience with non-target data processing strategies and industry-collaboration is an advantage, but not a requirement.
University level, research-based teaching experience and ability to explain and reflect upon own teaching practice and portfolio.

Assessment of applicants will primarily consider their level of documented, internationally competitive research. The ability to attract external funding will be considered together with outreach qualifications. Teaching qualifications are not mandatory but documented teaching qualifications and teaching experience will be considered.
Six overall criteria apply for assistant professor appointments at the University of Copenhagen. The six criteria (research, teaching, societal impact, organisational contribution, external funding and leadership) are considered a framework for the overall assessment of candidates. Furthermore, each candidate must be assessed according to the specific requirements stated in the job advertisement. Please read more at https://jobportal.ku.dk/videnskabelige-stillinger/kriterier-for-videnskabelige-stillinger/dokumenter-til-meritering/5a_Criteria_for_recognising_merit_-Assistant_professors.pdf .
Further information on the Department is linked at https://www.science.ku.dk/english/about-the-faculty/organisation/. Inquiries about the position can be made to Professor Jan H. Christensen, Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences, jch@plen.ku.dk.
The position is open from 1 July 2022 or as soon as possible thereafter.
The University wishes our staff to reflect the diversity of society and thus welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.
Terms of employment
The position is covered by the Memorandum on Job Structure for Academic Staff.
Terms of appointment and payment accord to the agreement between the Ministry of Finance and The Danish Confederation of Professional Associations on Academics in the State.
Negotiation for salary supplement is possible.
The application, in English, must be submitted electronically by clicking APPLY NOW below.
Please include 

Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master and PhD degree or equivalent)
Research plan – description of current and future research plans
If available, description and documentation of teaching and supervision experience and qualifications - please describe and document:
	
Experience with supervision of BSc and MSc students
Teaching experience
Formal pedagogical training

        211-0406/22-2E Associate Professor of Environmental Materials Biogeochemistry
    

Associate Professor of Environmental Materials Biogeochemistry
Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences
Faculty of Science
University of Copenhagen

The Department of Plant and Environmental Science (PLEN), University of Copenhagen invites applications for an Associate Professor within the field of Environmental Materials Biogeochemistry with start 1 November 2022 or as soon as possible thereafter. The position is in the Section of Environmental Chemistry and Physics (ECP).
Primary contributions from the associate professorship will be deep expertise in soil and material characterization at atomic to micrometer scales and under environmentally relevant conditions. Specifically, she/he will develop advanced characterisation techniques (e.g., synchrotron X-ray techniques, electron microscopy) for monitoring material properties and material-fluid(-biota) interfaces, and evolution thereof under changing natural conditions; to complement analyses of the fluid phase. The associate professor will also join advanced materials characterization and development related to remediation, fertilization/nutrient cycling, plant protection and climate technologies. Combined with measurements of processes in reactors, column and field scale, she/he will develop understanding of how system complexity scales with system size, to improve our ability to predict and model soil and biogeochemical processes in nature, with particular view towards environmental remediation, soil structures and dynamics, carbon and nutrient cycling in relation to vegetation.
The applicant should demonstrate research and insight with at least two of the following fields:

Solid state characterization of geo-materials including use of advanced techniques
Biogeochemistry of solid-solution processes in soils and sediments
Process understanding and development from laboratory to field scale ecosystems
Pollutant chemistry in soils and sediments
New materials for sustainable soil and water management, including remediation


The successful candidate is expected to show strong potential to establish a productive research program in environmental materials chemistry supported by external funding and to initiate research initiatives across departmental sections, to complement and enhance existing strengths of the section and department. The candidate is expected to have teaching experience from relevant courses and an interest in further developing teaching qualifications and contribute to teaching activities in environmental chemistry, biogeochemistry, advanced characterisation of environmental materials, basic chemistry, and related topics at PLEN. It is expected that the candidate has or is willing to bring in and develop leadership skills with the aim to take on the role as research group leader and other departmental services.
The candidate is expected to be enthusiastic about working in an interdisciplinary, academic environment conducting research and teaching at the highest international level. The position requires a highly motivated scientist, with an appetite for cross-disciplinary research, and who is comfortable working in teams, has good interpersonal skills, as well as a collaborative and open mind-set for leading collaboration with industry for innovations within environmental clean-tech and climate programs.
Applicants are required to have university level teaching experience, documented teaching competencies and must be able to explain and reflect upon own teaching practice and portfolio. Formal pedagogical training or supervision equivalent to the University of Copenhagen teacher-training programme for assistant professors is required.
The successful candidate is experienced in teaching in environmental chemistry courses, e.g. pollutants in the environment, biogeochemical processes and material and surface characterisation. The candidate is expected to show strong commitment and interest in the continued development of existing environmental chemistry courses, and supervision at the BSc, MSc and PhD level. Experience with supervision of BSc-, MSc-, PhD students or post docs.
Duties include the applicant’s own research, development of the field, assessment tasks, grant applications, and research management such as supervision and training of research fellows and other staff. The successful applicant must also teach, supervise, prepare and participate in examinations, and fulfil other tasks requested by the Department.
Assessment of applicants will primarily consider their level of documented, original scientific production at an international level, including contributions to developments in their field, as well as their documented teaching qualifications. Managerial and out-reach qualifications of applicants including ability to attract external funding will also be considered.
Six overall criteria apply for associate professor appointments at the University of Copenhagen. The six criteria (research, teaching, societal impact, organisational contribution, external funding and leadership) are considered a framework for an overall assessment of the candidates. Furthermore, each candidate must be assessed according to the specific requirements stated in the job advertisement. Please read more at https://jobportal.ku.dk/videnskabelige-stillinger/kriterier-for-videnskabelige-stillinger/dokumenter-til-meritering/5b_Criteria_for_recognising_merit_-Associate_professors.pdf .
The section covers environmental chemistry of soils and water, analytical chemistry, ecotoxicology, and agrohydrology/modelling. The section has its expertise on pollutant reactions, pollutant analysis, transport and effects in terrestrial and aquatic systems as affected by chemical, physical, and microbial processes in solution and at the solid-solution interface. Focus is on contaminants in biomass production systems with consequences for soil functioning, water quality and ecosystem stability. The section is highly depending on integrating chemical processes, analytical chemistry, and effect studies, data handling and modelling. https://plen.ku.dk/english/research/env_chem_phys
Further information on the Department is linked at https://www.science.ku.dk/english/about-the-faculty/organisation/. Inquiries about the position can be made to Head of Department Svend Christensen, svc@plen.ku.dk (+45 51489421) or Head of Section Bjarne W. Strobel, bjwe@plen.ku.dk (+45 51511912).

The University wishes our staff to reflect the diversity of society and thus welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.

The position is covered by the Memorandum on Job Structure for Academic Staff.
Terms of appointment and payment accord to the agreement between the Ministry of Finance and The Danish Confederation of Professional Associations on Academics in the State.
Negotiation for salary supplement is possible.

        211-0120/22-2N Tenure-track assistant Professor in Environmental Microbial Genomics and Evolution
    

Tenure-track Assistant Professor in Environmental Microbial Genomics and Evolution
Department of Plant and Environmental Science
Faculty of Science
University of Copenhagen

The Department of Plant and Environmental Science invites applications for a Tenure-track Assistant Professor position within the field of Environmental Microbial Genomics and Evolution with start 1 December 2022, or as soon as possible thereafter. The position is at the Section for Microbial Ecology and Biotechnology https://plen.ku.dk/forskning/mikrobiel-oekologi-og-bioteknologi/, and initially anchored in the Environmental Microbial Genomics (EMG) group headed by Professor Lars Hestbjerg Hansen.
The genetic context of e.g. secondary metabolites, antibiotic resistance genes or pesticide degradation genes is hugely important to their actual function. This context-driven approach is still underexplored in microbial genomics, but important in order to exploit the real potential of microbial solutions for societal challenges.
To address this developing field of microbial genomics, we are seeking a candidate with a research background in microbial genomics, bioinformatics and sequencing technologies in a microbial ecology and biotechnology context. With this position, we would like to strengthen research in all aspects of microbial genetics, with special emphasis on genetic parasites (plasmids, phages, transposons etc.) and their bacterial interactions, and involvement of these parasites in the active genetic development of antifungal properties, antibiotic resistance, xenobiotic degradation pathways and other functions relevant to humans and the environment. As part of the section’s strategy, the tenure track assistant professor will work towards establishing an independent research group, focusing on studying microbial genome evolution, genetic parasites and their impact on important phenotypic traits. 
The candidate will be expected to conduct independent research at the highest international level and establish his/her own research program within the area of microbial genetics, supported by external funding. As part of providing research-based teaching, the teaching obligations will be within microbiology, bioinformatics and microbial genetics at all levels. It will be an advantage that the candidate has teaching experience from relevant courses, and it is expected that the candidate will undergo necessary pedagogical training. For non-native Danish speakers, it is furthermore expected that the candidate will be able to teach in Danish after three years.  
The candidate is expected to be enthusiastic about working in an interdisciplinary academic environment. The position, therefore, requires a highly motivated scientist who is comfortable working in teams, have good interpersonal skills, as well as a collaborative and open mind-set. It is expected that the candidate develops leadership skills with the aim of gradually taking on administrative duties as required e.g. research group leader and other departmental services.
Research and teaching at the Department of Plant and Environmental Science, focus on plants, animals, soil, and microorganisms – from molecules through organisms to populations and anthropogenic ecosystems. The institute hosts state-of-the-art infrastructure, field research facilities, and many opportunities for collaborations within the department. It is our vision to maintain and develop our position as one of the principal centres for solving global challenges within agriculture, climate and plant science, based on excellent basic and applied research.
The Section for Microbial Ecology and Biotechnology conducts research in the areas of microbial ecology, environmental microbiology and microbial biotechnology. We aim to understand and exploit microbial diversity and interactions from both a genetic and ecological perspective and deliver basic knowledge as well as applied solutions to challenges within environmental pollution, plant production, aquaculture production and microbial ecosystem services. 

Qualifications

A Ph.D. or similar qualifications within virology, microbiology, biotechnology or other relevant research fields
Three to seven years of post-graduate research experience within microbial genomics and bioinformatics
An internationally competitive research output documented by a substantial number of co-authored scientific papers in internationally recognized journals, and experience in grant writing to attract external funding within the field of microbial genomics and genetic context-driven research. 
Extensive experience within Illumina and Nanopore sequencing (from library building to bioinformatics analysis) is desirable, with emphasis on non-standard applications on the Nanopore platform. 
A documented experience with teaching at the university level will be considered an advantage, as well as commitment to teach.
Commitment to and interest in the continued development of courses within the research area, and supervision at the BSc and MSc level
Good collaborative skills and a record of collaborative projects with academic or external stakeholders.
Experience with outreach activities and communication of research to the public via e.g., popular science articles.
Commitment to and interest in taking on administrative duties as required, e.g., as research group leader and other departmental services.
Commitment to achieve fluency in Danish as soon as possible, and no later than within 3 years (BSc level courses are taught in Danish).

 
Assessment of applicants will primarily consider their level of documented, internationally competitive research. The experience in grant writing to attract external funding will be strongly considered together with outreach qualifications. Teaching experience and formal didactic training are not mandatory but documented teaching qualifications/formal didactic training and teaching experience will be considered.

Six overall criteria apply for assistant professor appointments at the University of Copenhagen. The six criteria (research, teaching, societal impact, organisational contribution, external funding and leadership) are considered a framework for the overall assessment of candidates. Furthermore, each candidate must be assessed according to the specific requirements stated in the job advertisement. Please read more at https://jobportal.ku.dk/videnskabelige-stillinger/kriterier-for-videnskabelige-stillinger/dokumenter-til-meritering/5a_Criteria_for_recognising_merit_-Assistant_professors.pdf.
Further information on the Department and the section can be found here: https://plen.ku.dk/forskning/mikrobiel-oekologi-og-bioteknologi/. Inquiries about the position can be made to the Head of the Department, Professor Svend Christensen, tel. (+45) 5148 9421, svc@plen.ku.dk
The University wishes our staff to reflect the diversity of society and thus welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.

The tenure-track programme
An assigned mentor will provide the tenure-track assistant professors with guidance related to career development, other academic topics and administrative procedures.
Performance of the tenure-track assistant professor will be followed via internal yearly evaluations and a mid-term and final international evaluation by an assessment committee. If the ‘final appraisal’ is positive you will be promoted as associate professor. Performance and progression towards the criteria below will be evaluated with due consideration of differences between research fields. 
Criteria for promotion
After a 6-year tenure-track period tenure-track assistant professors are expected to meet the following criteria:

A strong publication track record within the specific field of research, including a significant number of corresponding authorships and at least some publications in high-ranked journals based on work carried out during the tenure-track period
Strong external network of collaboration, including joint publications
A significant track record of successful external research funding [Formuleringen tilrettes efter forskningsområdets muligheder for at tiltrække ekstern finansiering]
Establishment of a strong and internationally competitive research group demonstrating clear independence of former supervisors/mentors, or/and major contributions to the development of an existing research group demonstrating an ability to collaborate within the research group 
Completed https://www.ind.ku.dk/english/course_overview/up/ and established a teaching portfolio via participation in teaching, including preparation and development of departmental courses
Successful supervision/co-supervision of MSc and PhD students
